Archeologists believe that this discovery proves that man lived in this prairie at least 10 thousand years ago.

It holds a special significance in the study of ancient culture in Inner Mongolia's prairies, the living environment of ancient man in northern China, migration of national minorities in northern China and the production and raising of cattle in northern China regions.

hl.seg: 28/ Report: Philippines President's Visit to United States Fruitful

p.seg: / First and Last Addition /

Bush's commitment will help the Philippines, who is facing a budget deficit approaching 145 billion pizos (2.8 billion dollars), in preserving her foreign currency reserve in addition to stabilizing the pizo's exchange rate.

The American Agriculture Department will guarantee aid valued at 150 million dollars to modernize agriculture and fishing in the Philippines, and food aid valued at 50 million dollars is being processed for next year.

Arroyo re-iterated her decision to stand with the United States in fighting terrorism, and Washington agreed to give 100 million dollars in "security aid" to help Arroyo's Administration fight the Abu Sayyaf's group, which is still holding two American hostages in southern Philippines.
Military aid includes Huey Helicopters to support the military air campaign.
Bush also announced that aid worth about 55 million dollars will be given to the Philippines, which is torn by war, later this year and next year.

Despite the fact that the opposition described Arroyo's gains during her visit to the United States as "paper investments", Arroyo said that her visit paved the way to stronger Filipino-American cooperation and friendly relations in the new century following a fresh year of stronger partnership with the world.
Arroyo also flew to Mexico and met on Thursday with Mexican officials and investors on her way back from the United States.

hl.seg: 37/ Official: Lee Roy Huan's Visit to Three Countries Crowned with Success

p.seg: / First and Last Addition /

Lee said that China has enjoyed a fast economic growth for more than twenty years after she adopted a policy of openness and reform, but the overall development rate is not high and many sectors lag behind their international counterparts.
Lee said that many indisputable facts proved once and again that development in China will not only benefit neighboring countries but the whole world as well.
He said that China needs a lot of time to develop, learn advanced expertise from developed countries, and participate more strongly and effectively in international cooperation.
Cheng said that Lee also discussed issues of culture and development in the world.
Lee said that various countries' cultures are different from each other and that is the reason for intensifying exchange of view points and bolstering cooperation between them.

During his meetings with leaders of the three countries in which the leaders of Fiji and Papua New Guinea expressed their understanding for the importance of Taiwan issue and renewed their commitment to a single China policy, Lee explained China's position, from a political and pragmatic point of view, on the issue of Taiwan.

Lee also revealed to the leaders the multi-party cooperation system and political dialogue in China under the leadership of the Chinese Communist Party as well as the work of the political consultative conference.
The leaders of the three countries expressed their desire to learn more about the Consultative Conference and to intensify their contacts with the investment body.

hl.seg: 73 / France and Germany Call for Establishment of "Transitional Administration" in Afghanistan

p.seg: Paris 23 November / Xinhua / France and Germany called today for the establishment of a "transitional administration" as soon as possible before establishing a national reconciliation government.

A joint communiqu� issued by top officials from the two countries after their meeting in the city of Nant in western France, said, "our goal is to form a transitional administration as soon as possible in Afghanistan and then to establish a representative multi-ethnic legitimate government that aims to embrace human rights."

The communiqu� added, "We are joined in the hope for the convening of a United Nations Conference in Bonn under the auspices of Mr. Al Akhdar Al Ibrahimi, the Special Envoy of UN Secretary General Kofi Annan, who has our full support."
France and Germany called on the Afghani leaders to take responsibility for the country's future, according to the communiqu�.

The seventy-eighth Franco-German summit in Nant was attended by the French President, Jacques Chirac; the French Premier, Lionel Jospin; German Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder; and more than ten ministers from both countries.

hl.seg: Resumption of Peace Talks Likely Soon in Columbia

p.seg: Bogot� 23 November / Xinhua/ The resumption of peace talks between the Columbian government and the National Liberation Army is expected to be imminent in the next few days.
On Thursday, Columbia's Ambassador to Cuba, Julio London, said in a statement issued in Havana that significant progress was realized in preliminary contacts between the two sides.

The representatives of the government and / ELN/ Organization, which includes 4,500 fighters and is considered the second largest rebel group in the country after the FARC Organization, began holding meetings early this week in the Cuban capital, Havana.
The Columbian diplomat told Columbian Radio / Caracol/ that the two sides were trying during their meeting in Havana to reach "a general framework, agenda and rules for negotiations."
He said that the new round of talks between them took place at the end of the week.
Representatives from peace-process sponsoring countries, such Switzerland, Norway, Spain, France and Cuba, are expected to participate in the talks.

hl.seg: Spanish Prime Minister Calls for Re-enforcement of Relations Between Europe and Latin America

p.seg: Mexico City 23 November / Xinhua / The visiting Spanish Prime Minister, Jose Maria Aznar, called on Thursday for re-enforcing the political and economic relations between the European Union and Latin American countries to face the accelerating economic globalization and the changing world political situation.

Aznar said before a symposium on relations between Mexico and Europe that economic globalization has made the world more fragile and that the world economy is facing a serious test after the terrorist attacks of September 11.
He added that under such circumstances it is imperative for Europe and Latin American countries to bolster their commercial and political relations.
Aznar, whose country will preside over the European Union's session next year, said that his government wishes to share expertise in the area of anti-terrorism with Latin American countries.

The Mexican President, Vicente Fox, told the symposium that Mexico had paid a great deal of attention in the past years to expanding relations with the European Union and has achieved positive results.
He explained that the two sides must bolstered dialogue and cooperation in the area of environmental protection and anti-terrorism and, at the same time, bolster their economic relations.

hl.seg: Bolivia Declares State of Emergency to Face El Nino

p.seg: Lima 23 November / Xinhua/ The Bolivian government declared on Thursday a state of emergency to face the / El Nino / weather phenomenon.

Reports from La Paz, the administrative capital of Bolivia, indicated that the Sustained Development and Planning Ministry appealed to citizens to get ready for the possibilities brought about by this phenomenon, usually accompanied by torrential rains and floods in the Andes region in addition to severe drought in the equatorial prairies.

The Minister of Sustained Development and Planning, Ramiro Caffero Oriona, said that this phenomenon, when it swept the region five years ago, caused massive losses and destruction of agricultural crops in addition to death of cattle and displacement of thousands of citizens.
The country's National Weather Authority warned that the El Nino phenomenon will affect the country in the next few week, and may cause similar damage to the one caused five years ago.

Experts also warned that the non-steady rains may cause a 1.5-meter increase in the level of Lake Titikaka, which is located along the borders between Peru and Bolivia, and may submerge 10 thousand hectares of agricultural land.

hl.seg: Filipino Government Denies Link between Bioterrorism and Discovery of Anthrax Cases

p.seg: Manila 23 November / Xinhua / The Filipino Ministry of Health is closely watching nine cases of skin anthrax in the Ilocos Norte Province in the northern Philippines, and rushed to deny any link between bioterrorism and the surfacing of the three cases.
The //Manila Times // Newspaper said on Friday that the Minister of Health, Manuel Dayrit, assured the public that the government is capable of preventing the spread of the disease.

A report prepared by the National Epidemic Center and the Equatorial Medical Research Institute said that the anthrax cases took place on three occasions on the 2nd and 7th of October and the 7th of the November.
Tests conducted by the National Epidemic Center showed that the skin anthrax infection was brought about by infected cattle.
Minister Dayrit indicated that "these cases must not be linked in any way to bioterror attacks.

hl.seg: Latest Developments on American Attacks in Afghanistan

p.seg: / Second Addition /

-- Reports received here indicated that the Northern Alliance Forces will enter the besieged city of Kunduz, the last Taliban sanctuary in northern Afghanistan, after an agreement on Thursday with the Taliban leaders.

But some Northern Alliance officials said that Northern Alliance fighters who are not aware of this agreement launched an unorganized attack outside the city at the time when details about the agreement began to surface.

-- The Afghani opposition leader, Burhan El-Din Rayani, in an interview with the / Moscow News Times / Newspaper said that he does not rule out individual participation by individuals who represent the Taliban in the future Afghani government.
Rayani stressed that the Taliban as a terrorist organization is finished and cannot have a role in the future.
-- Britain said on Thursday that she does not see any need to deploy a large number of foreign forces in Afghanistan for the purpose of only protecting emergency food supplies.

hl.seg: The latest developments on the American attacks on Afghanistan

p.seg: \First addition\
-- Britain announced on Thursday that its Special Forces were working side by side with American Special Forces to pursue Osama bin Laden and his partners in the al Qaeda Organization.

Jack Straw, the British Foreign Secretary, stated in an interview with the BBC that the presence of the British Royal Marines and Special Forces was agreed with the Northern Alliance opposed to the Taliban.
-- Yemen denied newspaper reports which suggested that the Yemeni Security Forces had arrested a number of members of the al Qaeda Network, which is directed by Osama bin Laden.
An informed Yemeni source quoted reliable sources as saying on Thursday "Those reports have no basis and are totally lacking in truth."

-- It was stated on Thursday that workers with the International Red Cross had come across between 400 and 600 corpses in the town of Mazare Shareef of people who had died during the fighting in Afghanistan.
The spokesman for the International Committee of the Red Cross, Kim Gordon-Bates, stated: "We believe they are only a fraction of the corpses we will gather in Afghanistan."

hl.seg: Gardens of the organizations of Chinese students returning from abroad

p.seg: Sian November 25 \ Chenkhu \ 53 gardens have been founded for organizations of Chinese students returning from abroad so far this year in Chinese towns. These include 21 gardens at a national level.

It is known that the number of organizations in the garden of the returning students' organizations in the town of Sian, the capital of Shanxi Province in northwestern China, was in excess of 100 at the beginning of November this year, as opposed to 40 establishments last January.
Chinese towns are concerned with the creation of gardens for returning student organizations.
They have improved the levels of services and the working environment in them to attain international standards.
In addition to that, many preferential policies have been put in place to facilitate the work of returning students.

It should be noted that the returning students organizations play an important role in the globalization of the regional economy in their home countries and in raising the management levels in other organizations.

hl.seg: Air quality in "the invisible town"

p.seg: Lanchow November 24 \ Shenkhu \ Following treatment lasting a number of years, the air pollution in the town of Lanchow, called "the invisible town," has begun to improve in recent years.
It should be noted that the air pollution in the town of Lanchow, the capital of the Province of Kansu in northwestern China, becomes more severe during winter days.

Starting from 1998 the town began to implement the "project for the protection and treatment of air pollution in districts of the town of Lanchow" by changing the types of fuel and means of heating and taking obligatory measures for protection against pollution from industrial establishments, household waste and vehicle exhausts.
After three years of implementing this project, the urban environment and quality of life of the inhabitants of the town have witnessed significant changes.
In 1998 the levels of air pollution in the districts of the town were 423 during the winter. They dropped to 294 during the winter of 1999 and then to 238 during the winter of 2000.

hl.seg: Seven experts approve the plan to divert water from southern to northern China

p.seg: Peking November 24 \ Shenkhu \ Chinese experts have approved an ambitious plan to divert water from the southern to the northern part of the country and so prepare the way for the start of future general construction projects.
The experts approved the eastern part of the project at a meeting held here yesterday, Friday.
The plans for the western and central parts of the project were already approved by the experts.

Cheng Ji Yaw, Deputy Minister for Water Resources, stated at that time that preparations for the project were currently in full swing, while the preliminary designs for the eastern and central parts, which would remove the technical obstacles facing the start of future public project, were being finalized.
Cheng stated that his ministry had in fact completed the overall plan for the project to divert the water and that final amendments and reviews were being made.
The project for the diversion of water from the south to the north would transfer the rich water resources in the Yangtze River valley to the arid northern parts of China.
It should be noted that the feasibility of the project had been under review for five decades.

hl.seg: The number of Algerian flood victims rises to 744 dead.

p.seg: Algiers November 24 \ Shenkhu \ The number of Algerian flood victims has reached 744 dead with the discovery by search teams of nine more bodies in the last twenty four hours among the rubble of the afflicted Bab El-Ouadi District, while the number of victims in capital districts reached 694 dead. The remaining victims were in the western provinces of Algeria, El-Shalif, Tibaza and Ghalizan.

Thousands of Civil Defense, National Guard and Police personnel are still working day and night to remove the remaining effects of the floods and inundations which struck the Algerian capital on Black Saturday, while all the technical assistance teams from France, Morocco and Tunisia have left Algeria. All the roads leading to the afflicted districts and internal roads have been opened, and the power, water, telephone and gas lines have been restored to their previous state following the massive destruction they sustained.
Life has begun to return to normal with anxious attention to the searches under the rubble and the expectation that more dead victims will be found.

hl.seg: The latest developments in the American attacks on Afghanistan

p.seg: \ Fourth addition \

The Interfax news agency quoted his statement in Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan, that following the victories of the northern opposition "The role of the Taliban in the political arena has been eliminated, and this fact gives impetus to the optimism surrounding the implementation of plans to create a peaceful settlement" for this country proposed by Russia, the United States, Tajikistan and other countries.
-- On Friday the BBC quoted officials in the British Ministry of Defense as saying that it was unlikely that large numbers of British forces would be deployed to Afghanistan.
The officials added that it was unconfirmed whether there was a need for the deployment of further numbers to be added to the Marines and Special Forces currently deployed there.

hl.seg: 52 Palestinian children killed by Israeli bullets in Bethlehem

p.seg: Gaza November 25 \ Shenkhu \ This Sunday evening a 13-year old Palestinian child named Kifah Khalid Ubeid was killed. He died from wounds suffered as a result of Israeli soldiers opening fire at random with bullets in the direction of Palestinians around the Bilal bin Rabbah Mosque close to Bethlehem on the West Bank.
Palestinian sources stated that the child was struck in the chest by a bullet fired by Israeli soldiers during a demonstration during which stones were thrown in the direction of the soldiers.
For its part, the Israeli army stated that its soldiers had been subjected to gunfire during the demonstration.

The demonstrators had responded to an invitation from all Palestinian groups to demonstrate in protest of the killing of five Palestinian children when an Israeli booby trap exploded last Thursday in the Gaza Sector and against the assassination last Friday of a military commander of the Islamic Resistance Force, Hamas, in an attack by Israeli helicopters.

hl.seg: The Ibero-American Summit supports Colombian peace operations

p.seg: Lima November 25 \ Shenkhu \ The Eleventh Ibero-American Summit declared its support Saturday for the "determined" efforts of Colombian President, Andres Pastrana, to strengthen the peace process in his country, which has been torn apart by the war.

Leaders of Latin American countries, Spain and Portugal confirmed in their declaration the need for unlawful armed forces in Colombia to cooperate and move forward with the peace process through peace negotiations.
The leaders considered the resumption of communications between the Colombian government and the National Liberation Army, the second militia group in the country, to be a positive sign.
The leaders urged all rebel forces in Colombia not to involve civilians in the dispute and avoid "unacceptable practices" such as kidnappings.
They also reiterated their desire to support the Colombian government and people in their undertaking to strengthen national reconciliation.

hl.seg: The Information Technology Industry in a Chinese Province

p.seg: Sian November 26 \ Shenkhu \ Ban Lian Cheng, the Deputy Governor of Shanxi Province in northwestern China, stated recently that the information technology industry had been transformed into the major backbone industry in this province.
He added that this industry was first among all industries in the previous eight years for growth and attained 26.
1 billion yuan of the value for industrial production last year, which is a quarter of the total.

This province witnessed massive development in the building of infrastructure for information networks. The total length of long distance fiber optic cables amounted to 8,800 kilometers, and the total length of local fiber optic cables amounted to 23,600 kilometers. This covers all the cities and districts and 90 percent of the towns and villages in the province.
It forms a digital transmission network reliant on fiber optic cables and supported by digital microwaves and satellites.
Currently in Shanxi there are 6.7 million telephone users and 270 thousand data users.
A fixed line and mobile telephone system has also been formed covering every city and district and most towns and villages.
The television and radio broadcast network will cover all the districts and cities and more than 900 regions and villages. Construction began in 1996, and the foundation was recently completed.

hl.seg: Treatment of the sources of sandstorms and desert creep in northern China

p.seg: Shijiatshuang November 28 \ Shenkhu \ Hopei Province, which encompasses the cities of Peking and Tientsin in northern China, intends to implement a project to deal with the sandstorms and desert creep which are overtaking the two cities by investing 22.5 billion yuan over the next ten years.
The project includes the conversion of agriculture to woods and forests on the barren hills and treating pasture land and small basin areas.

A Shenkhu correspondent learned from the Province Forestry Department that the land area suffering from desertification covers 14.5 per cent of the total area of the province. Thus there are desert lands in 114 out of a total of 149 counties and cities in the province.

The Chinese government is determined to implement a project to deal with the sources of the sandstorms and desert creep with massive investments in an attempt to alter the ecological features in the area around Peking and Tientsin.

Over the next ten years, according to the plan drawn up, agriculture will be converted into woodland on an area of 574.2 thousand hectares and afforestation will take place on the hills and barren land which cover the same area. Forests will be planted on an area of more than 1.2313 million hectares. 2,936,513 hectares of grassland and about 6,080 square kilometers of small basin areas will be treated. This will occur in 24 counties and areas around the cities of Tshangjiaku and Tshangada in which there are three sandy regions.

hl.seg: China's gross domestic product reaches nine trillion yuan this year \ 67

p.seg: Peking November 26 \ Shenkhu \ It is expected that China's gross domestic product for the year 2001 will reach nine trillion yuan, an annual increase of 7.3 per cent.
The National Statistics Office stated that this rate of growth was much higher than the world average, which is estimated at 1.3 per cent.
According to the figures issued by the Office the country's gross domestic product exceeded one trillion yuan in 1986, and since 1993 has seen an increase of nearly one trillion yuan annually.

The period from 1978 to 2000 has seen the fastest development in China: the average annual rate of growth of the gross domestic product has reached 9.5 per cent, in comparison with 2.5 per cent in advanced states and five per cent in developing countries.

hl.seg: \ 73 A follower of the Falun Gong kills his family members

p.seg: Peking November 26 \ Shenkhu \ The police reported that a follower of Falun Gong was arrested in Peking for killing his father and wife and seriously injuring his mother.

The police found two persons who had been stabbed to death and a woman who had suffered serious injuries in a residential building in the Shenzhen District of Peking after it had received a report at 17:55 yesterday.
The accused, Fu Yi Ping was immediately arrested and the injured woman was taken to the hospital.

Fu, who became a follower of Falun Gong in 1998, admitted to the police that he had stabbed his father and wife to death and injured his mother with a kitchen knife in his father's home after he had "learnt" that "they were required to move house."
The police discovered a video recording and tapes and memoranda about Falun Gong in Fu's place of residence.
The case is currently being investigated.
According to official statistics the Falun Gong sect, which the Chinese government prohibited in 1999, has caused the death of more than 1,600 persons in China.

hl.seg: The exchange of Saudi currency for 5 million forged dollars is thwarted \ 1

p.seg: Riyad November 26 \ Shenkhu \ The security forces in Jeddah Province in the west of Saudi Arabia have thwarted an attempt to exchange genuine Saudi banknotes for five million forged US dollars.

The local newspaper "Al-Iqtisad" quoted Brigadier Salah Al-Alyan, the Chief of Police in Jeddah, as saying that the security authorities had been able to arrest five persons of an African gang which had attempted to change Saudi banknotes, which were not forged, with a value of about three million riyals for five million dollars.

Al-Alyan explained that the quantities seized were found in bags and covered with a layer of genuine dollars on the top and bottom, while all the banknotes in the middle were not genuine and some of them were blank.

Al-Alyan explained that the gang tried to hand over the goods with undue haste without allowing the other party to check the amounts and he said that their arrest took place just before the Saudis were to hand over the five million dollars for the three million riyals.

hl.seg: \ 6 Taliban: The opposition seizes the Kandahar - Sabeen Bouldak road

p.seg: Islamabad November 26 \ Shenkhu \ A spokesman for the Afghan Taliban confirmed today Monday that the opposition forces had seized the highway between Kandahar and the border town of Sabeen Bouldak.
This was stated in a report by the Afghan Islamic News Agency.
The spokesman, whose name the news agency did not specify, stated that the opposition forces seized the highway yesterday, Sunday, and that it was now totally cut.
He stated that the northern alliance forces had also seized the strategic town of Takhtapol following a fierce bombardment by American war planes.
The news agency quoted arrivals from Sabeen Bouldak as saying that a group of American Special Forces had reached that border town and that helicopters were seen with them.

hl.seg: \ 20 Iraq rejects in advance any amendment to the memorandum of understanding

p.seg: Baghdad November 26 \ Shenkhu \ Iraq has announced its prior rejection of any amendment to the oil for food and medicine agreement signed with the United Nations, without consultation on it.

Naji Sabri, the Iraqi Foreign Minister, said in press statements published today: "Iraq will reject the oil for food agreement if new amendments proposed by Britain and the United States are made to it." He continued: "There will be no agreement if the Iraqi government does not accept the amendments."

Sabri asserted that Iraq will not accept any amendments to the oil for food program, emphasizing that if the other side wished to impose any amendment resulting from pressure brought to bear, the agreement would be revoked and not binding on Iraq.

It should be noted that the tenth phase of the oil for food program will terminate at the end of this month and the program must be renewed, that is to say that the Security Council must approve a decision either to extend the operation of the current program or amend it before 30 November this year.

It is noted that at the beginning of this month the British Foreign Secretary, Jack Straw, had discussed with his Russian opposite number, Igor Ivanonof, a plan for special smart penalties after Britain announced its determination to make some amendments to the smart penalties.

Political observers consider that the plan for smart penalties will not be proposed to the United Nations unless there are positive signs from Russia that it will accept them and approve this project, because Russia had previously in July threatened to veto these penalties, which had led to its withdrawal.
Iraqi officials assert that the position of the Russian government towards smart penalties had not changed, stating that it was a positive position and one which rejects these penalties.

hl.seg: \ 29 Tajikistan will allow French bombers to use an air base

p.seg: Moscow November 26 \ Shenkhu \ Tajikistan has agreed to offer an air base in Kulyab, a town located on the Afghan border, as a base for a number of French bombers.
This was stated Monday by Russian news agencies quoting sources in the Tajik capital, Dushanbe.

An agreement has been signed for this during recent negotiations between the Tajik President Emomali Rakhmonov and the French Minister without portfolio for Cooperation and Francophone Affairs, Charles Josselin, who was on a tour of central Asia.
This was stated by the news agency Itar Tas.
The report stated that there is no information available on the number of French bombers and technical personnel who will come to this country which is in central Asia.
Itar Tas stated that France had also asked Kirgizistan to provide a military air base for eight Mirage 2000 war planes, which will participate in military operations in Afghanistan.
It stated quoting a spokeswoman for the Foreign Ministry in Kirgizistan that the request was currently being studied and that a decision would be issued shortly.

hl.seg: \ 31 Jiang Zemin meets Neil Ling

p.seg: Peking 26 November \ Shenkhu \ The Chinese President, Jiang Zemin, met Doctor Neil Ling, the previous assistant to the American President's [Office] of Science and Technology Policy.

President Jiang and Ling exchanged points of view on trends in international development related to science and technology and Chinese / American cooperation in the arena of economics, science and technology.
Jiang commented that China is the largest developing country in the world whilst the United States is the largest advanced country in the world.
And each of the two countries complements the other in the economic fields and they both have great capacity for scientific and technological cooperation.
He stated: "We welcome more friends from American scientific and technological circles and business organizers to cooperate with their Chinese counterparts."

He added that strengthening cooperation between the two countries in the fields of politics, economics, science, technology, and other fields was of great importance to the achievement of stability and development in the world.
He expressed his hope that Ling would make new offers of cooperation for Chinese / American friendship and exchanges in the field of science and technology.
Ling stated that changes in China had made a great impression on him.

Since the establishment of diplomatic relations between the United States and China, the two countries had achieved broad cooperation, including cooperation in the field of science and technology and that such cooperation must become stronger.

hl.seg: Fugitives from massacres in the world gather in Rwanda \ 46

p.seg: Nairobi November 26 \ Shenkhu \ About 250 fugitives from massacres in a number of countries are currently meeting in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, to share their experiences and remember the massacres they were exposed to, according to reports reaching here today.

The main Rwandan League for fugitives from massacres, the Ibuka Organization and Holocaust survivors and their children, whose head office is in New York, are participating in the organization of the conference which will last six days starting today under the title: "Life after death."

In his speech at the opening ceremony held yesterday, Antoine Mugesera, the President of the Ibuka Organization, which is a confederation which includes the League of Fugitives from Massacres, based in Rwanda, stated: "The objective of this conference is to discuss how the memory of victims of massacres can be honored and kept alive, and to investigate means of improving the living conditions of fugitives."

Ibuka stated in an announcement that it would permit survivors of the Jewish holocaust, from the Tutsi massacre in Rwanda, those from massacres in Armenia and massacres of Gypsies, native Americans and other communities who were a target for systematic extermination, to share their experience of life as survivors.
Yayli Danily, the Director of the Group, which is based in New York, stated: "The holocaust and massacres will remain with us for ever."
When we speak out, we prevent its transmission from one generation to the next."
It should be noted that Hutu extremists slaughtered about 800 thousand of the Tutsi minority during the massacre of 1994 in Rwanda.

hl.seg: Strengthening cooperation between Shanghai and the Chinese Academy of Natural Sciences \ Second and last addition \

p.seg: It is reported that cooperation between the Chinese Academy of Natural Sciences and the City of Shanghai in the field of science and technology started in August 1995.
They were successful in implementing major projects, developing scientific research centers, high technology manufacturing and technical inventions.

Thanks to their joint efforts six centers for scientific research have been established so far in Shanghai, including a biological research center, a new materials research center, a gene research center and a new medicines research center have been established.
These centers have achieved a number of research successes, such as a map of the rice genome and an international map of the human genome.
Some of them have achieved a first rate international status

hl.seg: \ 100 The United Nations dismisses three of its officers who are associated with war crimes in Bosnia

p.seg: The United Nations, November 27 \ Shenkhu \ The United Nations has announced that the Commander of the Special Forces of the International Police Force of the United Nations in Bosnia and Herzegovina had issued a decision to dismiss three Bosnian Serb officers who were associated with attacks on non-Serb individuals in the town of Fouka during the Bosnian war.

A United Nations mission in the country stated that commander Vincent Kirdirwi stated that the officers were no longer able to participate in any Police Force project either at the present time or in the future in any place in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The mission stated that the three were working in the Police Force in the town of Fouka.

This dismissal is considered to be the most recent measure in a series of dismissal decisions issued by Special Forces of the International Police Force against officers associated with war violations in Bosnia.

hl.seg: \ 9 China boasts that it has 100 million mobile phone users

p.seg: Peking November 27 \ Shenkhu \ The Chinese Mobile Communications Group announced yesterday, Monday, that it has more than one hundred million mobile telephone users, according to a statement by the Quang Ming daily newspaper, which is based in Peking.

The newspaper stated that this makes the Mobile Communications Group in China the first operator in the world to boast that it has a hundred million users, which also represents an important event in the mobile communications industry in the country.

It was further stated that since November 1987, when it established the first mobile communications system in China, the Mobile Communications Group had developed a communications network and had built a close partnership with more than 140 counterparts abroad for international services.

During these four and a half years the number of mobile telephone users has multiplied from 10 million to a hundred million currently. This was announced by Lu Chiang Dong, the Deputy General Manager of the group. He added that the number is still growing at a rate of 120 thousand every day.
He stated that the group was classified among the largest 500 companies in the world.

hl.seg: \ 91 A delegation from the Refugees' Affairs Commission visits Uganda

p.seg: Kampala November 27 \ Shenkhu \ A press statement issued by the Office of the High Commissioner for Refugees' Affairs of the United Nations stated that a high level delegation from the Commission would arrive in Uganda tomorrow on a visit lasting two days.
The delegation under the leadership of Mary Ann Wyrsch, Deputy Head of the Commission, will visit the Adjumani Camp, which is the largest refugee camp in Uganda, with 57,460 refugees living in it.
The statement added that the mission would obtain direct information about the various programs and projects the Commission undertakes in Uganda.
The delegation will also meet Musa Ali, Second Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Works for Disasters and Refugees, and James Wapakabulo, the Third Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister.
It should be noted that Uganda is currently host to 179,143 refugees from Sudan, Democratic Republic of Congo, Congo, Rwanda, Somalia, Ethiopia, Burundi, Kenya and Eritrea.

hl.seg: Teaching Arabic in the University of Palermo next year

p.seg: Tunis November 27 \ Shenkhu \ An agreement has been reached between the Libyan Academy and the Faculty of Arts in the University of Palermo in Italy, that the Mili Institute in Sicily will teach Arabic starting from the beginning of next year.

A report from Tripoli on Monday evening stated that Libyan television had reported the same evening that the signature of this agreement will take place in the context of the inauguration of the Libyan Academy's cultural activity in the city of Palermo. This will include holding seminars, lectures and cultural meetings in addition to signature of the agreement to teach Arabic.
Under the agreement Arabic will be taught by lecturers specializing in the field of Arabic and Islamic studies under the supervision of the Libyan Academy and the University of Palermo.
The program for teaching Arabic and Islamic Culture will include its various economic, religious and legal branches.

hl.seg: Spain supports free trade talks between the European Union and the Andes Group

p.seg: Lima November 27 \ Shenkhu \ The visiting Spanish Foreign Minister Josep Pique stated here today, Monday, that Spain will urge the European Union and the Andes Group to establish a free trade area between the two economic groups.

Pique, whose country will take up tenure of the periodic presidency of the European Union from next January, said that it was important to reach an agreement despite the fact that the task of achieving this objective may be complex.
He explained that Spain is ready to carry out the task during 2002 through its tenure of the periodic presidency of the European Union.
Pique told the Peruvian radio station "R.P.P." that Spain had reached an agreement with Mexico on the matter, and it will reach a similar agreement with Chile during the first half of 2002.
Further negotiations will be conducted with the common market in South America "Mercosur" to sign the free trade agreement.
Mercosur includes Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay and Uruguay.

hl.seg: The first television play in China on AIDS

p.seg: Peking November 28 \ Shenkhu \ The first performance of a Chinese television play on AIDS will take place on international AIDS day on the December first.
To mark this occasion the Chinese Central Television Station will transmit the play, whose title is "If it struck me tomorrow" at peak time on the evening of December first.
It is produced by the National Center for Communications and Instruction in Family Planning with the assistance of the State Family Regulation Committee.

It is anticipated that the play "If it struck me tomorrow" will arouse general interest among all social sectors because it is the first television play to depict the life of an AIDS patient to be shown in China.
It tells the story of a successful businessman who picked up the AIDS virus following a casual love relationship.

hl.seg: Indian forces open fire along the Kashmir line of control \ 46

p.seg: New Delhi November 28 \ Shenkhu \ The Indian Press Trust news agency stated today that Indian forces had killed more than 16 Pakistani soldiers and destroyed 12 of their depots along the line of control in Kashmir yesterday evening.

The agency quoted military sources in the region, which India controls, as saying that Pakistani forces opened concentrated fire yesterday evening on Indian positions, pounding them with mortars and wounding a number of Indian soldiers in an Indian forward position on the de facto border between the two countries in Kashmir.
The sources added that the fire and bombardment prompted the Indian forces to reply and this lasted until late at night, in the border area of Butsh in India.

An official in the government here stated today that the armed clashes that had taken place over a long period between the Indian and Pakistani forces in the disputed valley, had caused the loss of 9,524 lives since the beginning of 1998 and up to 30 September this year.

The Minister of State for Internal Affairs, Vidyasagar Rao, told the Senate in the Indian Parliament, the Rajya Sabha, in a written answer that 3,166 Civilians, 1,382 members of the Security Forces and 4,976 terrorists had died during this period.

The Minister added that a total of 770 persons, including 513 armed men, 112 security personnel and 145 civilians had died in Kashmir, which India controls, since the terrorist attacks sustained by the United States on September 11.

hl.seg: An international symposium on road safety in China \ 60

p.seg: Nanking November 28 \ Shenkhu \ Chinese and foreign experts are attending an international symposium on road safety here to enlist additional scientific methods to prevent road accidents.

More than 150 management and road safety experts from China, the United States, Britain, Canada, Japan and Singapore participated in an international symposium on increasing road safety and the prevention of traffic accidents in Nanking, the capital of Kiangsu Province, in eastern China, today.
They agreed that the problem of road safety becomes increasingly serious with economic development and social progress in the world.
It was stated in the meeting that about one million people are killed annually in road accidents throughout the world and a further 25 million are injured.
The World Health Organisation has warned that road accidents could give rise to more victims if effective measures are not taken.
The participants in the symposium believe that road accidents not only harm the lives of people, but also directly affect the effectiveness and quality of communications.

hl.seg: The number of cases of mad cow disease in Italy increases to 41 \ 92

p.seg: Rome November 28 \ Shenkhu \ Case number 41 of mad cow disease, or bovine spongiform encephalitis was discovered today for the first time in cattle slaughtered in the Campania Region in the south of Italy, according to a statement by sources in the Cattle Research Institute in Italy today.
The Institute confirmed that in spite of the slaughter of the cattle near Caserta, this case came from a farm in Vicenza in the north.

It stated that the tests performed on the brain cells of animals five years old, in the National Mad Cow Laboratory in Turin had confirmed the initial results on the existence of cases of this disease.

Domenico Venezia and Antonio Lemon, the two directors of the Institute stated: "This report reveals the effectiveness of testing measures and we are able to say with all certainty that the cattle in Campania have so far been free from mad cow disease.

The Italian Ministry of Health subsequently confirmed that a total of 41 cases of mad cow disease had been found so far, since Italy started its inspection program for this lethal disease which destroys the brain, in January, in accordance with the instructions of the European Union.
So far about 400 thousand tests for this disease have been conducted.
The Italian government has recently reduced the age for compulsory testing of cattle from 30 months to 24 months.

hl.seg: Perez calls for a renewal of negotiations with Syria \ 112

p.seg: Jerusalem November 27 \ Shenkhu \ Haaretz, the leading Israeli newspaper, stated on its internet site that the Israeli Foreign Minister, Shimon Perez, had today called for a renewal of negotiations with Syria, "without prior conditions".
The report did not reveal the occasion on which Perez issued this call, although it stated that Perez did not elaborate on this issue.
Israel had resumed negotiations with Syria at the end of 1999 following a cessation which lasted about four years.
However the discussions reached an impasse last January.
The report quoted sources here as saying that Perez's call was related to a probable change in the US standpoint on the disputed Shaba farms on the border between Israel, Lebanon and Syria.

Whereas Lebanon and Syria insist that the Shaba farms are Lebanese, Israel claims that it captured them from Syria in the 1967 war and that the fate of this region could be decided in peace talks between Syria and Israel in the future.

A report in the newspaper also stated that the Secretary General of the United Nations, Kofi Anan, would probably agree with the Syrian and Lebanese view that the region is a part of the territory of Lebanon.
The United Nations had supported the Israeli position and considered Israel's withdrawal from southern Lebanon complete.

hl.seg: Death of an American intelligence officer in a revolt by prisoners in Afghanistan \ 81

p.seg: Washington November 28 \ Shenkhu \ An American Central Intelligence Agency officer died during a revolt by prisoners near Mazar-E-Sharif in northern Afghanistan, according to a statement by the American agency today.
This officer, whose name was Mike Span, is the first American whose death has been officially acknowledged during the war operations in Afghanistan.

Mike Span's body was recovered as soon as the northern alliance forces, which are supported by American and British Special Forces, overcame the revolt undertaken by hundreds of foreign captives who support the Taliban and al-Qaeda organization. The agency did not reveal details of the death of the intelligence officer, who was 32 years old.

Previous reports stated that a member of the American army was killed in an exchange of fire during the revolt which took place last Sunday, but the Bush Administration denied these reports and insisted that all members of the American forces were in place.

The Administration announced subsequently that five members of the American army were wounded during the bombardment which was launched by US warplanes to provide air support for the forces of the Northern Alliance to control the disturbances.
In addition to Span, three members of the American forces were killed outside Afghanistan in incidents related to the military strikes which began on 7 October.

hl.seg: Telephone contact between the Jordanian monarch and American president

p.seg: First and last addition

The Jordanian Royal Office announced in a statement that President George Bush had confirmed during a telephone conversation, that the United States of America will exert its influence during the coming stage to urge the parties concerned to accept an immediate ceasefire and prepare the way to return the peace process to its correct path.

Bush confirmed during the communication that the United States was determined to achieve peace in the region and create a just solution to the Palestinian issue which would guarantee the rights of all parties and provide security and stability to the peoples of the region.

This communication is the second between the Jordanian king, Abdullah the Second, and the American President, George Walker Bush, in less than a week. A lengthy telephone conversation took place between them last Thursday and during it, the developments of the situation in Palestinian territory and the efforts to combat terrorism were discussed and studied.

hl.seg: The Islamic Organization for Medical Sciences condemns the cloning of the first human fetus

p.seg: First and last addition

Dr. Abdul Rahman Al-Awadi, the President of the Islamic Organization for Medical Sciences, said in a statement by the Organization: "Our major anxiety about this operation is that it is done with a view to the abortion of a fetus after it has been killed and its cells are taken for exploitation without any ethical or legal principles.

The statement warned of the consequence of disregarding this issue and leaving it unchecked. He added that mankind must not forget its major lesson of the recent past learned from splitting the atom and the massive damage which later appeared and which was unknown and unexpected.

The statement called for the formation of committees specializing in bioethics to authorize an international charter on the rights of the fetus in preparation for the issue of a law on the rights of the fetus.

hl.seg: Appointment of Chinese to the management of foreign financial institutions

p.seg: First and last addition

The gradual entry of large numbers of Chinese managers into the management, and even the boards of directors, of such companies derives fundamentally from their awareness of the economic, cultural, legal and domestic circumstances and their familiarity with them, besides the reduced of the cost of employing them. Therefore a considerable number of companies have employed Chinese to fill middle and high ranking management positions and even appointments on boards of directors.
Furthermore it is clear from the survey that more than 90 per cent of institutions are seeing the appearance of a trend towards local management or an increase in local management in such companies.

The survey revealed that a number of years after the creation by multinational corporations of joint venture companies in China, the increase by the foreign partner of its capital to expand the volume of its shares in the company has in general been highlighted and this trend in their management, away from the foreign partner, has become clear with the passage of time.

Reference is made to the fact that in the Tayanjing Development Region the share of foreign investment in joint venture and cooperative companies amounted to 65.8 per cent and 69.9 per cent consecutively, and the number of foreign financial companies exceeded the number of joint venture and cooperation companies put together.

hl.seg: \ 92 China readjusts the economic infrastructure

p.seg: First and last addition
The conference stated that the reform of state owned companies will remain in the foreseeable future the essence of a comprehensive operation to restructure the economy.

It is essential to continue the far-reaching operation for reforming state owned companies in line with the requirements "of specific ownership and clear rights and obligations, on the basis of the distribution of management tasks and scientific management.
It is also essential that the structure of companies should be improved in a manner which will combine both rights and responsibilities, work smoothly and apply effective restrictions.
The conference stated that large and medium sized companies owned by the state which fulfill the previous requirements must speed up the conversion operation until they become joint stock companies.
Efforts must also be made to continue to progress the strategic reorganization of state owned companies.

It is also important to strengthen and merge a group of large companies within the framework of their ideological characteristics and controlling authority which can assist them in conditioning themselves to international competition now that China has joined the World Trade Organization.
Various ways must also be found to enliven and activate medium sized and small companies owned by the state and to create a social security system.
It is also important to take greater steps to reform and set standards for a market economy system and to strengthen the legal structure.
It is also essential to create awareness within society of the ethics of commercial activity, the standards of trust and the meaning of fairness and honest competition.

hl.seg: \ 12 Iraq announces its readiness to negotiate with Kuwait and Saudi Arabia regarding missing persons.

p.seg: Baghdad November 29 \ Shenkhu \ Dr. Naji Sabri Al-Hadithi, the Iraqi Foreign Minister, stated that his country was ready to negotiate with Kuwait and Saudi Arabia to reach a final solution to the problem of missing persons.

Al-Hadithi said in a statement issued today to "Al-Zawra", a weekly newspaper which speaks for the Iraqi Journalists Union: "Iraq will seek a speedy solution to this human problem, the problem of the missing persons, either directly between Iraq and Kuwait and between Iraq and Saudi Arabia or in a tripartite meeting bringing us together within the framework of the Arab League in a joint Arab effort."

He clarified that Iraq had released all the prisoners of the war, numbering 6,222 persons, including eight members of the ruling family in Kuwait. He added that Iraq had received three representatives of the Arab League and accepted the decision of the Ministerial Council of the League in 1999 to establish a mechanism to press this matter, in addition to initiatives from a number of Arab heads of state.

Al-Hadithi asserted that the latest point accepted by Iraq to conclude this matter was an initiative proposed by Italy to bring together Iraq, Kuwait and the International Committee of the Red Cross to study the matter of the missing persons following Kuwait's agreement to it. He explained that a meeting in Rome had been arranged for last September, indicating that Italy had again informed Iraq that the Kuwaiti side had withdrawn and revoked its agreement to the initiative.

It should be noted that Kuwait accuses Iraq of holding 600 of its citizens as prisoners of war and calls for their release, whilst Iraq asserts that it has released all the captives and states that Kuwait still refuses to provide it with information on 1,137 persons lost during the Gulf War in 1991.

hl.seg: The probable death of 213 Haiti migrants during their attempt to reach the United States

p.seg: Havana November 29 \ Shenkhu \ A government official from Haiti stated on Wednesday that he feared that about 213 Haiti migrants, who left their country at the beginning of November, drowned following the failure of their attempt to reach the United States.
Members of the families of these migrants stated that about 150 persons left the island of Ile-�-Vache facing the southern shores of the country on board a single boat on the first of this month.
The following day another boat set off, carrying 63 migrants, according to statements received from Port au Prince, the capital of this Caribbean country.

Relations of the migrants stated they had heard no news of either of the boats, and if the migrants had reached land they would have sent letters to their families to reassure them, according to their relations' statements.
However hurricane Michelle, which struck the region in November, makes it highly improbable that they are alive, as it is very likely that the two boats sank in mountainous waves.
Because of the alarming economic situation in this country, many of its population resort to making a dangerous journey in the hope of reaching the American coast.

hl.seg: A meeting of Yugoslav and Bulgarian army commanders to discuss military relations

p.seg: Belgrade November 29 \ Shenkhu \ Yugoslav and Bulgarian army commanders held discussions Wednesday in Nis, the small town in southern Serbia, on the situation in the region and bilateral military cooperation.

The Yugoslav Chief of the Staff, Nebojsa Pavkovic, said to journalists following the meeting with his Bulgarian counterpart, Miho Mihov, that the points of view of the two parties concurred on all the issues discussed and they agreed to cooperate to counter terrorism.

For his part, the Bulgarian Army Commander stated that the agreement to counter terrorism was of great importance to the two countries and also to their armies. He added that the two sides had also exchanged military training skills for men and military maneuvers.

It should be noted that early this month the Defense Minister of Yugoslavia, Slobodan Krapovic, met his visiting Bulgarian counterpart, Nicolai Svinarov, in Nis where they discussed the situation in the region and cooperation in defense matters.

hl.seg: A powerful earthquake strikes southern Mexico

p.seg: Mexico City November 29 \ Shenkhu \ A powerful earthquake which reached 6 on the Richter scale struck southern Mexico early on Wednesday. So far no reports have been received on the level of injuries and damage.
The southern state of Chiapas was the area most affected by the quake. It sustained a partial power cut and telephone services were suspended.
According to an announcement by the Civil Defense Authority in the state.
The earthquake occurred at 8:32 in the morning local time, 14:32 GMT. Its epicenter was off the Pacific coast of the state of Chiapas.
The quake was also felt in the states of Oaxaca and Puebla and even in Mexico City, which is 760 kilometers north west of the quake's epicenter.
It was also felt in a number of areas in Guatemala, the southern neighbor of Mexico, where citizens went out into the streets in fear.
Reference was made to the fact that the state of Oaxaca sustained two powerful quakes in 1999, their strength reaching successively 6.7 and 7.5 on the Richter scale.

hl.seg: Public conveniences in the streets of Peking

p.seg: Peking November 30 \ Shenkhu \ Peking has planned to construct 200 public conveniences in its main streets and urban areas. The distance between conveniences will be 800 meters.
The new public conveniences, whose construction will be supervised by the government, will be open to citizens free of charge.

At the beginning of this year the capital began to renovate the existing public conveniences in the alleys or narrow passages of the old city because many of them were built half a century ago and are incompatible with health standards.
However these conveniences are insufficient.
And according to a report issued in the "Peking Daily" newspaper, tourists and citizens have time and again complained of a shortage of public conveniences.
It is anticipated that the construction of the new public conveniences will take place next year.
At the same time new restaurants in Peking are required to build their own conveniences for their customers.
And restaurant owners who violate this regulation will be forced to close.

hl.seg: \ 40 China values its economic cooperation with Pakistan

p.seg: Peking November 30 \ Shenkhu \ The Minister of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation, Shi Kuang Sheng, stated here today, Friday, that cooperation between China and Pakistan in the Saindak Copper and Gold Mines Project will help strengthen bilateral economic and commercial relations.
Shi stated this during his meeting with the Pakistani Minister of Petroleum and Natural Resources, Osman Aminuddin.
Shi said: "China and Pakistan enjoy good bilateral relations and have achieved great progress recently in economic and commercial cooperation."

Aminuddin expressed his appreciation of the assistance offered by China to Pakistan in power exploitation. He said that he hoped that cooperation with China in prospecting for petroleum and natural gas, coal and other minerals would be enhanced.

hl.seg: Summary of economic news from around the world \ first and last addition \

p.seg: An official in the Kremlin stated to journalists following a meeting between Putin and Nazarbayef, who arrived here on Thursday to participate in the Summit for the tenth anniversary of the Commonwealth of Independent States which will be held here on Friday, "such progress as this may facilitate the signature of a bilateral agreement on equal exploitation of the seabed resources of the northern Caspian Sea."
Bangkok -- Thailand is on the brink of a land crisis because the quality of more than 60 per cent of its land is declining ...
according to a report issued on Friday by the National Association for Land and Water Conservation.
It quoted Chayaset Aneeksamfa, the President of the Association, as saying that the whole world is facing the problem of soil erosion and Thailand is no exception.

The report stated that investigations had shown that more than 60 per cent of the total land of Thailand, or about 192 million rai (one rai equals 1,600 square meters), is suffering from denudation, and the main problems are its conversion to fine dust and other land to sandy soil, with an area of 41 million rai and 40 million rai respectively.

hl.seg: China develops software to estimate vehicle damage

p.seg: Naninyang 30 November \ Shenkhu \ An initial trial of software has been successful in evaluating vehicledamage in China in 55 towns since last July.

In a traffic accident which occurred recently involving an insured vehicle on a highway in the autonomous region of Guangzhi - Zhuang ethnic group in southern China, an estimate of the cost of the damage and that of printing a list of spare parts with their prices, using a portable computer with the software, took those who made the estimate no more than ten minutes.
The Chinese insurance sector stated that it had spent about 200 million yuan, 24 million US dollars, on developing and evaluating this software.
The Chinese experts took five years to develop it.

hl.seg: Consumption of natural gas in the largest industrial center in China

p.seg: Shanghai December First \ Shenkhu \ During 2005, Shanghai's annual natural gas consumption will reach three billion cubic meters.

According to the natural gas consumption plan for the period 2001 - 2005, about 600 thousand to one million families in Shanghai, the largest industrial and commercial center in China, will be new users of natural gas, which will replace coal as a fuel in those five years.

During this period Shanghai will invest 5.7 billion yuan, 689 million US dollars, on natural gas pipeline projects and the related infrastructure to make natural gas available on a wide scale, not only for home consumption, but also as fuel for more than 3,400 buses and as primary materials for chemical processing plants.

The experts stated that the planned increase of one billion cubic meters of natural gas in place of coal gas will save three million tonnes of standard coal. This will reduce the emission of carbon dioxide by 36 thousand tonnes per year and smoke particulates by 30 thousand tonnes.

hl.seg: \ 6 Zhu Rongji meets the Chairman of the Vietnamese Party

p.seg: Peking December 1 \ Shenkhu \ The Premier of the Chinese State Council, Zhu Rongji, stated here today that China attaches great importance to commercial and economic cooperation with its neighbor Vietnam.
Zhu made this statement during his meeting with Nong Duc Manh, Secretary General of the Central Committee of the Vietnamese Communist Party.

Zhu, who is also a member of the Standing Committee of the Politburo of the Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party, stated that the two countries complement each other in commercial and economic development and therefore enjoy a great capacity for commercial and economic cooperation.

He stated that China wishes to find new possibilities for economic cooperation with Vietnam on the basis of the principle of mutual benefit, and to strive to achieve tangible results, a high level of cooperation and joint development.

On his side, Manh stated that he was pleased with the development of commercial and economic relations between the two countries and asserted that commercial and economic relations are an important part of bilateral relations.
He added that the two sides must cooperate to strengthen border trade and give impetus to cooperation in major construction projects.

hl.seg: \ 8 The Chinese and Vietnamese Parliaments undertake to give backing to cooperation

p.seg: Peking December 1 \ Shenkhu \ Li Peng, the Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National Congress stated to the deputies of the Chinese people here today that the Congress hoped to give backing to exchanges and cooperation with the Vietnamese National Assembly to improve bilateral relations and cooperation.

Li, who is also a member of the Standing Committee of the Politburo of the Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party, made these statements during his meeting with Nong Duc Manh, the Secretary General of the Central Committee of the Vietnamese Communist Party.

Li reported that relations between the two parliaments are an important part of Chinese Vietnamese relations, saying that the National Congress of the Chinese People's Deputies and the Vietnamese National Assembly must learn from each other in law-making and give backing to all aspects of communications through a process of reform and openness in both countries.

On his side, Manh expressed his expectation that the exchanges between the two parliaments would enrich the content of bilateral relations and he called for both sides to promote cooperation and mutual consultations in bilateral and multipartite arenas.

Li praised the current visit by Manh, which is the first visit major visit by a senior Vietnamese leader in the new century. He stated that high level exchange visits play an essential part in the development of relations between the two parties and the two nations.
Li also explained to the delegation China's point of view on the current international situation and the formation of a common market economy.
Manh stated that there was a shared determination between the two leaderships to support their traditional friendship and develop it within the context of the current complex international situation.

hl.seg: Multinational companies create research and development centers in Shanghai

p.seg: Shanghai December 6 \ Shenkhu \ Last month the companies IBM, Nestle, Alcatel, Bayer and Microsoft established research and development centers in the City of Shanghai, the largest industrial and commercial center in China.
Thus the number of multinational companies' research and development centers in this city has now reached more than 40.
It was stated that Shanghai licensed 1,115 foreign financed industrial projects in the first ten months of the current year.
So far 260 of the largest 500 companies in the world have come to Shanghai.
At the same time the number of research and development centers established by Chinese companies in Shanghai has passed 200, of which more than 20 are of national status.

hl.seg: \ 28 Discussions between the Foreign Ministers of Chinaand Democratic Congo

p.seg: Peking December 6 \ Shenkhu \ The Chinese Foreign Minister, Tang Jiaxuan, held discussions here today with the Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Leonard She Okitundo.
Tang stated that the two peoples of China and Democratic Congo enjoy a long friendship in spite of the distance between the two countries.
There is friendly, balanced and fruitful cooperation between the two sides in the political, commercial, economic and educational arenas.

He stated that China values the Democratic Congo's adherence to the standpoint of a single China and is ready to study new arenas for cooperation to strengthen the ties of friendship between the two countries.

Tang explained to the guests the stance of the Chinese government towards the issue of human rights, stating that China and Democratic Congo both have similar points of view in this regard and a desire for further cooperation and support between the two countries.

Tang also explained to Okitundo the stance of the Chinese government towards the struggle in the Democratic Republic of the Congo and expressed his hope that the struggle between the two sides would be resolved through dialogue and consultation.

hl.seg: \ 10 The Chairman of the Chinese National Council meets the Foreign Minister of Democratic Congo

p.seg: \ first and last addition \
Zhu also valued the efforts of the government of Democratic Congo in promoting the peace process in the country, national reconciliation and stimulation of the national economy.
Zhu asked Okitundo to convey the greetings of the Chinese President, Jiang Zemin, and also his own greetings to the President of the Congo Republic, Joseph Kabila.

Okitundo said that the government of the Congo Republic devotes great attention to its relations with China and that the relations between Democratic Congo and China had witnessed a new development since President Joseph Kabila came to power in his country.

Okitundo stated that Kabila and his government value the support and help of China and indicated that China, as a permanent member of the Security Council, always supports the struggle of the government and people of Democratic Congo to protect unity, peace and territorial sovereignty.
He stated that Congo will strengthen cooperation with China in international assemblies and supports China's stance on human rights issues.
He repeated that the Congo government will pursue with determination the policy of "China is one", and expressed his hope for the reunification of China at the earliest possible opportunity.
He stated that the Congo government will work to strengthen current bilateral friendship and cooperation to the benefit of both sides.
Okitundo asked Zhu to convey the greetings of President Kabila to President Jiang.

hl.seg: \ 94 The Russian President arrives in Athens

p.seg: Athens December 6 \ Shenkhu \ The Russian President, Vladimir Putin, arrived here today under the shadow of tough security measures, on an official visit lasting three days by invitation of his Greek counterpart, Costas Stefanopoulos.
Putin met Stefanopoulos immediately after his arrival.
He announced to journalists before the meeting that an end to " ideological differences" had confirmed the geopolitical foundations of Greek Russian friendship.
He confirmed that Moscow and Athens had similar points of view on various issues, including the Balkans, quoting the resurgence of bilateral trade figures.

Local newspapers stated that a number of bilateral agreements will be signed, on matters including air freighting, transportation, cooperation between police forces, justice, power, and the establishment of cultural centers in the two countries, during Putin's visit here.
Putin's arrival in Athens is the first official visit by a Russian head of state since the creation of the modern Greek Republic.
Hence local observers consider it to be of great political importance in spite of the fact that the visit is purely in response to the visit by Stefanopoulos to Russia in June last year.

hl.seg: \ 24 Vietnam calls for an end to acts of violence in the Middle East

p.seg: Hanoi December 6 \ Shenkhu \ A Vietnamese spokeswoman issued a statement calling on the parties concerned to exercise self control and for an immediate cessation toacts of violence in the Middle East.

In the statement the spokeswoman said, on behalf of the Foreign Minister Van Thieu Thanh, that the peace process in the Middle East faces massive challenges especially following the attacks by Israeli planes and tanks against offices of the Palestinian National Authority, which caused heavy human and material losses to the Palestinians, complicated the position and threatened peace and stability in the Middle East region.

Thanh called upon all involved parties to act to build confidence and resume negotiations on the basis of International Security Council resolutions 242 and 338 and the principle of "land for peace", to reach a peaceful, just and permanent solution which will meet the legitimate interests of the parties concerned.

hl.seg: \ 104 The Italian Foreign Minister urges a strengthening of relations between NATO and Russia

p.seg: Rome December 6 \ Shenkhu \ Diplomatic sources in Brussels stated that the Italian Foreign Minister, Renato Ruggiero, had called for a strengthening of relations between Russian and NATO during a meeting of the Alliance ministers today.
The sources added that Ruggiero said that Italy supports Russia joining NATO eventually, with recognition of the fact that this operation would be long and difficult.
He expressed the need for cooperation between NATO and Russia to go beyond the 19 plus 1 formula, according to the sources.
Ruggiero confirmed that Italy's position was similar to the position of the other NATO members and especially the United States and Britain.

it should be noted that the Secretary General of NATO, George Robertson, who opened the meeting today, willtogether with the North Atlantic Council, hold discussions tomorrow with the Russian Foreign Minister, Igor Ivanov.

hl.seg: Thailand signs a credit loan agreement with China

p.seg: Bangkok December 6 \ Shenkhu \ The Governor of the Bank of Thailand, Pridiyathorn Devakula, traveled to China to sign a credit loan agreement valued at 2 billion US dollars with China. This quashed rumors that the agreement meant that the country's foreign currency reserves were at a dangerous level, according to the Thai news agency, today, Thursday.

The agency quoted Pridiyathorn as saying that the agreement only aimed at increasing the liquidity of foreign currency reserves in Thailand, and that the 2 billion dollar sum would only be made available for use in an emergency.
The Governor of the Central Bank admitted that the country's foreign currency reserves had suffered difficulties in the past, but he said that the current level of the reserves was satisfactory.
The Governor of the Central Bank warned that attention must be paid to the foreign currency reserves since investors had been encouraged to believe that the Thai economy was in a good state.

Pridiyathorn admitted that the Central Bank had seen a small deviation when it decided to change its financial policies from concentration on the foreign currency reserves to concentration on stimulating the economy. He went on to say that were it not for the severe economic collapse, there would have been no major change of policy.
The Governor of the Bank of Thailand added that the Bank would make an effort in the coming year to enable commercial banks to obtain higher interest by making further loans to stimulate the economy.

hl.seg: China draws up draft regulations in accordance with promises to join the World Trade Organization

p.seg: Peking December 6 \ Shenkhu \ The Chinese State Council discussed and passed in principle a number of draft regulations, Wednesday, to in fulfilment of its undertaking to the World Trade Organization after joining it.
The discussion and approval took place at Executive Meeting 49 of the State Council chaired by the President of the State Council, Zhu Rongji.

The draft regulations include: a resolution of the State Council to review articles regarding the management of tourist agencies, regulations on the management of foreign-financed communications firms, articles concerning the People's Republic of China's international marine transport, and articles concerning the management of the People's Republic of China's foreign-financed insurance companies.
According to the meeting these documents will be published following further amendments.

hl.seg: A competition to design shoes in Hong Kong

p.seg: Hong Kong December 7 \ Shenkhu \ The Shoe Design Competition 2002 will be held in the Hong Kong Special Administrative District with the objective of preparing a new generation of shoe designers and transforming Hong Kong into the most important shoe design center in Asia.
The competition will be held in three sections, formal shoes, casual shoes and sports shoes.
The prize winning entries in this competition will be displayed in the Asia and Pacific Shoe and Leather Exhibition 2002 and other international commercial exhibitions.

Reference is made to the fact that the volume of shoe exports from Hong Kong reached 51 billion Hong Kong dollars last year, taking second place in the world, including 49.1 billion Hong Kong dollars for shoes made in interior regions of China.

hl.seg: A Chinese city is transformed into an investment hot spot

p.seg: Hofei December 8 \ Shenkhu \ With the introduction of more multinational companies, the City of Hofei, capital of the Anhwei Province, has become an investment hot spot in the central China region.
More than 300 businessmen from abroad participated in a trade exhibition held here recently.

More than 600 agreements were made in a number of areas such as electronic data, biological projects, production of medicines, environmental protection, computer programs and namometric technology etc..

Lai Ping Rung, the Deputy Director of the Motorola Company, which participated in the exhibition, said that foreign businessmen were looking with interest at the City of Hofei because it was a high-technology city.
The City of Hofei, the first of four bases for teaching science in China, has more than 30 high schools and 200 scientific research establishments, in which about 200 thousand researchers work.
It benefits from policies encouraging investment in the development of western China because of its geographical location.

hl.seg: \ 50 The new administration in Kandahar urges the US led coalition to stop the bombardment

p.seg: Islamabad December 7 \ Shenkhu \ The Afghan Islamic news agency stated that the recently formed administration in Kandahar had today urged the US led coalition to cease bombarding the town now that the Taliban militias have surrendered their weapons.

El-Hajj Bashir, who is one of the leaders of the Noorzai ethnic groups in the new Kandahar administration, told the news agency that American war planes had continued their attacks on the town in the morning causing the death of four civilians in a vehicle during the American bombardment.
He said: "In view of the end of Taliban rule in Kandahar, we urge the US led coalition not to launch further air strikes."

hl.seg: \ 64 The Yemeni President visits Saudi Arabia

p.seg: Sanaa December 7 The Yemeni President, Ali Abdullah Saleh, left the town of Hodeida this afternoon and traveled to the City of Jeddah on a visit to Saudi Arabia.

The Yemeni news agency stated that President Saleh would meet the Saudi monarch, King Fahd bin Abdul Aziz, and Prince Abdullah bin Abdul Aziz, the crown prince, and would engage in discussions with them on the means of strengthening brotherly relations and good neighborliness between the two countries of Yemen and Saudi Arabia.

There will also be mutual consultations and an exchange of views on regional, Arab, Islamic and international developments and recent events, which concern both countries and the Arab and Islamic nations, at the forefront of which are the current developments unfolding in occupied Palestine and Afghanistan and the international efforts to combat terrorism.
President Saleh will also inform the Saudi leadership of the results of his visit to the United States of America, Germany and France and his discussions with the leaders of those countries.
The Yemeni President is accompanied by Abu Bakr Al-Qurbi, the Foreign Minister, and ministers in the Yemeni government on his visit to Saudi Arabia.

hl.seg: Press: The Australian Parliament was a target for terrorist attacks

p.seg: Canberra December 7 \ Shenkhu \ A local newspaper, the Sydney Morning Herald reported today, Friday, that the Al-Qaeda network belonging to Osama bin Laden had planned to attack the Australian Parliament.

The newspaper reported, quoting officials in the Indian Ministry of the Interior, that an Indian civilian called Mohamed Afrouz had admitted participating in planning the attacks of September 11 last. He said that it had initially been planned to launch attacks on the Australian, British and Indian parliaments in addition to the attacks on Washington and New York.
