Among those who attended the meeting were Vice Premier Qian Qichen and other senior officials.

hl.seg: 73 / Annan: There's a need for collective international efforts to solve Middle East problems

p.seg: United Nations 19 December / Xinhua / United Nation Secretary General, Kofi Annan, said today that the international community should exert collective efforts to bring peace to the Middle East, where tensions were escalating because of the acts of violence taking place in the past few days.
In the press conference held at the end of the year in the main headquarters of the United Nations in New York, Annan said, "This effort should be collective and international".
He also pointed out that "the situation in the Middle East looks less hopeful now", and added, "the parties cannot solve this conflict alone.
There is a need for concerted efforts to bring back the parties to the negotiating table, and the time has come for that".
Annan added that the European Union, Russia, Egypt, Jordan and other countries were exerting efforts to bring back the Israelis and Palestinians to the negotiating table.

About the emergency meeting of the General Assembly to be held tomorrow to discuss the Middle East, Annan said, "The General Assembly and the Security Council are the two entities that member states can appeal to" but "I cannot pre-judge the manner in which discussions will be conducted".

The President of the General Assembly Session 56, the South Korean Han Sung Su, declared here today that the special meeting would be held tomorrow at 3 pm Eastern United States time, on a request from the Egyptian permanent representative at the United Nations on behalf of Arab states.
It should be pointed out that no fewer than 776 Palestinians and 233 Israelis have been killed since the outbreak of violence again between Israelis and Palestinians last September.
The violence reached its peak this month.

hl.seg: American Congress approves of the Bush plan for school reform

p.seg: Washington 19 December / Xinhua / The American Senate expressed on Tuesday the support of both parties for President George Walker Bush's plan for school reform, which calls for reforming the general educational system in an almost complete manner.

The Senate gave its final agreement by 87 votes against 10 votes to ratify the modified version of the bill, which had been presented and agreed upon by both the House of Representatives and the Senate a long time ago.
The House of Representatives ratified the bill last week by 381 votes against 41 votes.
Bush welcomed this agreement, which he considered a major item on his political agenda after his election as president.

In general, the bill devotes a total of 26.5 billion American dollars to primary and secondary school education in the 2002 budget, with an increase of 4 billion dollars compared to the previous fiscal year.
Primary and Secondary school education law makes it imperative for all students from Grade Three until Grade Eight to sit for reading and mathematics exams every year.
For the first time, marks will affect the amounts of federal funds given to schools and the manner in which they are spent.
Schools that continue to receive low marks will be forced to offer part of the federal funds to students for help with private tuition or for moving to another public school.
Additional help will be offered to schools where recorded marks do not improve for two years running.
If marks do not rise after that, the educational staff of the school should be changed.

hl.seg: Brazil asks Mercosur for its agreement on negotiations with Mexico

p.seg: Brasilia 19 December / Xinhua / Brazilian Foreign Minister, Celso Lafer, said on Tuesday that his country would discuss with its partners in the Southern Common Market, Mercosur, the possibility of obtaining permission to negotiate a free trade agreement, FTAA, with Mexico.
In a press conference in Rio de Janeiro, Lafer added, "We're discussing this question and it will be decided in Uruguay's capital, Montevideo".

The Minister added that his country will try to use the opportunity of the coming summit in Montevideo to request permission from its partners, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay, to negotiate a free trade agreement with Mexico as an exceptional case".

It should be pointed out that Mercosur has been in the custom of conducting all trade agreements with countries or groups as a single block, which is the reason why Brazil could not go ahead with this attempt.

hl.seg: 51 / Rwandan President affirms improved relations with Uganda

p.seg: Nairobi 20 December / Xinhua / The Rwandan President, Paul Kagame, revealed that the relations between Rwanda and neighboring Uganda, had improved in the wake of the talks held in London in early November between himself and his counterpart, Yoweri Museveni, according to a report by the Rwandan News Agency today, Thursday.
In his speech in the press conference in the Rwandan Capital, Kigali, Kagame said that there was no tension between the two countries as it was in the past.
The President was reported to have said that "there was tension between the two sides two months ago but this tension has eased now.
We continue to work together to establish stable relations or to push them even to the levels of a few years ago".
According to Kagame, the talks held in the United Kingdom between himself and Museveni had laid down the mechanisms of improving relations.
He reiterated the need for working towards preserving the stability of the situation.
At the same time, the Ugandan President, Yoweri Museveni, lately issued orders to government officials not to comment on the current relations between Rwanda and Uganda.
The relations between these two African states that are traditional allies became tense during the past two years. Each country accused the other of harboring the opposition of the other side.

In his comment on the current crisis in the Republic of the Congo, Kagame said that a great deal has been achieved until now, such as the implementation of the Lusaka peace agreement. He affirmed that the countries implicated in the crisis of the Democratic Congo took a step towards putting an end to the crisis, and cited the withdrawal of some foreign troops as an example.
He added that what remained was to establish a dialogue between the Congolese parties, and to disarm the rebel groups operating in the Democratic Congo.

hl.seg: 70 / Jordan getting ready to cooperate with Palestinian farmers

p.seg: Amman 20 December / Xinhua / The Jordanian Agriculture Minister, Dr. Mahmoud Al- Dowairy, and his Palestinian counterpart, Hekmat Zaid, who was accompanied by a delegation, agreed in their meeting today in Amman to form a specialized technical committee to lay down the mechanisms of cooperation between the two sides.

The Jordanian News Agency, Petra, said that the Jordanian Minister affirmed during the meeting Jordan's willingness to cooperate with the Palestinian Agriculture Ministry in serving farmers' interests, and to lend support to the firm stand of the Palestinian people on their land. He made particular reference to the importance of coordination in the fields of plant and animal protection, preservation and quality.

The two Ministers discussed aspects of agricultural cooperation between the two sides in various other agricultural fields, and the exchange of expertise and cooperation within regional and international frameworks.
The Palestinian Minister had arrived here earlier today on a visit to Jordan lasting several days.

hl.seg: 35 / Erekat: The Arab dimension is the main support for the Palestinian People

p.seg: Cairo 20 December / Xinhua / Palestinian Minister of Local Government, Saeb Erekat, called upon the Arab Foreign Ministers starting an emergency meeting in Cairo later today to agree to send an Arab delegation to Washington, with the aim of fully explaining the situation in order to stop Israeli aggression against the Palestinian people.

In a special interview broadcast on the Egyptian "Voice of the Arabs" radio, relayed through a telephone line between Cairo and the Palestinian city of Jericho today, Saeb Erekat reiterated that the "Arab dimension remains the main point of support for the Palestinian people. The world understands only the language of interests, and Arabs need to speak to the world using this language".

Erekat pointed out that "three million Palestinians, with President Yasser Arafat at the forefront, were prisoners in their own lands and homes". He re-affirmed that "what the Head of the Israeli government, Ariel Sharon, is doing at present is evidence of his fluctuating attitudes".

hl.seg: Portugal ratifies the Kyoto protocol

p.seg: Lisbon 20 December / Xinhua / The Portuguese Cabinet ratified on Wednesday the Kyoto protocol, which aims at effectively controlling climatic change in the whole world, according to an official statement here.
A spokesman for the Portuguese Environment Ministry said that such a ratification did not need the agreement of Parliament.

The Cabinet said that Portugal ratified the protocol 6 months before the final date decided by the European Union, which had pledged an 8 percent reduction of greenhouse gases during the period from 2008 to 2012.
According to the Kyoto protocol, the polluting gases in Portugal should not exceed 27 percent of the 1990 levels.

Local Scientists said that if greenhouse gases are not brought under control, temperatures in Portugal may increase by 9 degrees Celsius in the summer between the year 2080 and 2100. The sea level is also expected to rise between 25 and 110 centimeters.

hl.seg: Algeria signs a partnership agreement with the European Union

p.seg: / Second and last addition/

Regarding Algeria's participation in pushing forward the peace process in the Middle East, the Algerian President, Abdul Aziz Butaflika, said that his country would not be able to interfere in negotiations that had already started. He reaffirmed that the important thing was that the Algerian stand was similar to all other Arab countries, in that they all regarded the Palestinian President, Yasser Arafat, as the only negotiator with Israel. He could not accept any other logic.

On his part, the European Commission Presiden, Romano Prodie, in a joint press conference, promised support for Algeria's efforts to join the world Trade Organization. He also promised to help boost regional cooperation between the countries of the Arab Maghreb within the framework of the Barcelona Euro-Mediterranean partnership.

He reiterated that the initial signing of this agreement is considered a crucial step towards pushing forward the Euro-Mediterranean cooperation, especially in view of the fact that the coming presidency of Spain of the European Union would give priority to this objective.

The new Algerian Ambassador in Brussels, Halim Bin Attallah, and the Director of the European Commission Department for the Middle East and the South Mediterranean, Van Der Mullen, signed the agreement.

hl.seg: Japan recognizes the interim government in Afghanistan

p.seg: Tokyo 20 December / Xinhua / Japan recognized today, Thursday, the interim administration in Afghanistan, two days before its official formation next Saturday.
Kyodo News Agency said that the Cabinet ratified the decision this morning, Thursday, during an emergency meeting.
The Japanese Deputy Foreign Minister, Yoshiji Nogami, had earlier said that it was not necessary to wait for the official inauguration of the interim government before recognizing it.
Japan, even after such recognition, will need time to establish a diplomatic presence in Afghanistan. The former Japanese Embassy in Kabul had been completely destroyed, according to Nogami.

Japan had established diplomatic ties with Afghanistan for the first time in 1931. These ties, however, were severed after the Soviet invasion of the country in 1979. Japan has not recognized any group in the country since then.

hl.seg: The opening of a 338m-high touristic tower in Macao

p.seg: Macao 20 December / Xinhua / A touristic tower rising 338 meters high was opened to visitors on Wednesday in Macao. It is the tenth highest building in the world.

Attending the opening ceremony were Ma Man Che, the Vice President of the National Council for the Political Advisory Conference of the Chinese People, Edmund Ho Hau Wah, the Chief Executive of the Macao Special Administrative Region, Pai Xi Jian, the Head of the Central Government's Communications Office in Macao, and Yuan Tao, the Foreign Ministry envoy, as well personalities from the various sections and groups of Macao.

The General Director of the Macao Company for Tourism and Entertainment LTD said that the opening of the tower coincided with the second anniversary of the return of Macao to the Motherland, and is therefore considered a "special gift".
The tower will bring more tourists to Macao.
The tower is considered a new symbol of Macao.
Its construction started in 1998 with an investment of 1.1 billion Macao Pataca.

hl.seg: Three persons killed in a hotel fire in North China

p.seg: Hohhot 20 December / Xinhua / Three People including the Deputy Mayor were killed in a blaze that broke out Wednesday evening in the city of Hohhot, the Capital of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, in North China.
The local police said today, Thursday, that the fire broke out at 23:30 last night in a Hohhot hotel, leading to the death of three people and the injury of 17 more.
Two people are still missing until now.
More than 180 firefighters were sent to the site of the accident and they managed to extinguish the fire at 4 am Thursday morning.
Police said that the fire started in a dance hall on the first floor of the two-storey hotel suite, which led to the collapse of the whole building.
Investigations into the cause of the fire are being carried out now.

hl.seg: 33 / 8 Arabs arrested in Somalia

p.seg: Nairobi 21 December / Xinhua / An official in the Somalese transitional government said here today, Friday, that eight Arabs were arrested in Somalia here yesterday.
He said that among the eight were 2 Iraqis and 2 Yemenis, who had been in Somalia without valid documents or visas.
But he refused to declare whether they had any connection with international terrorism.
He added, "We don't know who they are and what they are doing in Somalia. That's why we arrested them for investigations".
He said that his government was looking for other foreigners residing illegally in Somalia.

American officials have frequently expressed their fears that there are groups or individuals in Somalia connected with international terrorism, and especially with Al-Qaida Network led by Usama Bin Laden.
The temporary Somalese government has often voiced its intention to join the international campaign against terrorism.
On Thursday, the Pentagon denied reports that Somalia was the next target of this campaign.
The Somalese Prime Minister, Hassan Ibshir Fareh, arrived in Nairobi to attend the current reconciliation talks with the armed groups opposing the government.
It should be pointed out that there was chaos in Somalia after the overthrow of the country's leader, Mohamed Siad Berry, in 1991.
The national transitional government was formed last year and since then has succeeded in convincing many warlords to accept its rule.
The government controls only some parts of the capital and pockets in the rest of the country.

hl.seg: Smuggling operation involving large quantities of drugs in Lebanon foiled

p.seg: Beirut 21 December / Xinhua / The Lebanese anti-narcotics police foiled a smuggling operation of a quantity of cocaine estimated at around 75 kgm. The cargo was transported by a ship arriving in Beirut sea Harbor, coming from Latin America via Britain.

According to local media reports Thursday evening, the anti-narcotics bureaus in Britain and Lebanon followed up the ship and its cargo, and monitored its stoppage program in British waters first and then in its second stop in Lebanese water,.

The Lebanese Interior Minister, Elias Almar, who played an active role in the narcotics operation, disclosed the fact that a number of Lebanese nationals implicated in the narcotics smuggling operation were arrested. He said that he would reveal all aspects of the operation in a press conference on Friday.

The Lebanese Interior Minister expressed his belief that this step would boost Lebanon's position in the world. He commended the cooperation between the Lebanese and the British anti-narcotics bureaus.

hl.seg: ECOWAS Summit opened in the Senegal

p.seg: / First addition /
The member states of the Second Unified Currency Zone are: Nigeria, Ghana, Guinea, Sierra Leone, Liberia and Gambia.

Since the start at the beginning of this year of WAMI, which has its headquarters in the Ghanean capital, Accra, it has been assigned the task of providing technical support to, and coordinating the efforts of, the member states of ECOWAS, in order to facilitate the adoption of the second currency.
The leaders of ECOWAS will choose a name for the prospective second unified currency in the Dakar summit, according to a statement issued by the group.
It should be pointed out that the First Monetary Zone in West Africa, composed of the francophone countries, has been in existence since colonial times and uses a unified currency, the franc.
The statement indicated that both the first and second zones would try to establish a unified currency in the ECOWAS area in the year 2004.

hl.seg: Tourism still receding in the most important tourist cities in Morocco

p.seg: Rabat 22 December / Xinhua / Tourism has fallen sharply in the city of Agadir, one of the most important tourist cities in Morocco, after the 11 September events in New York and Washington.

Tourism in this famous coastal city fell during last November by around 43 percent compared to the same period the previous year. This came in a statement issued by the Tourism Authority in the city late on Friday.

The tourism statement said that around 27000 tourists, including internal tourists from other parts of the country, visited the city in November, in comparison with 47000 during the same period the year before.
Tourist night outings in this tourist city also dropped by 44 percent, while hotel occupancy fell by 40 percent on average.
The statement added that the city has been suffering from a drastic drop in the numbers of tourists visiting it since September 11. During last October, the numbers fell by 46 percent.

hl.seg: Latest developments relating to American military strikes in Afghanistan

p.seg: / Second and last addition /

Al-Akhdar Al-Ibrahimi, the Special Representative of UN Secretary General, Kofi Annan, in Afghanistan, will give a speech in the ceremonies taking place in Kabul today, Saturday, celebrating the transfer of power to the new interim administration.

According to the list of temporary arrangements issued here on Friday in the United Nations Headquarters, Al-Ibrahimi will give a speech to more than 2000 participants expected to congregate in the Interior Ministry Auditorium.

The American President, George Walker Bush, said on Friday that the country has become safer than it was before the September 11 terrorist attacks. But the state of alert would continue throughout the Christmas and New Year holidays.

In the Oval Office of the White House, Bush said to the group of journalists congregating for the end of the year review of events, "The country is much safer today and less open to attacks than it used to be before 11 September, because the enemy has openly announced that we are being targeted, and we have responded".

hl.seg: Secretary General of the Arab League offers congratulations on the establishment of the Arab-Chinese Friendship Society

p.seg: Beijing 22 December / Xinhua / The Secretary General of the Arab League, Amr Moussa, sent a message of congratulations on the establishment of the Arab-Chinese Friendship Society.

The Xinhua representative received here today a copy of the message in which Moussa said that this Society represents an effective framework for coordinating Arab-Chinese efforts at this very important stage of the relations between the Arab League and the People's Republic of China. This stage requires more dialogue and cooperation between the Arab and Chinese peoples through collective Arab cooperation with the People's Republic of China.
He added, "We are confident that the Society will work hand in hand with bilateral friendship societies that exist between different countries".

It should be pointed out that the ceremony in honor of founding the Arab-Chinese Friendship Society took place yesterday, Friday, and was attended by Vice Premier, Qian Qichen, and by representatives of Arab countries. The suggestion to establish this Society came from the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries.

hl.seg: New evidence concerning origin of the city of Shanghai

p.seg: / First and last addition /
Song said, "Research on Longsheng pottery samples indicates that they are made of local clay".

He added, "If further research on additional samples of new graves reaches the same conclusion, it is possible that people from the Yellow River had moved and settled in Shanghai, bringing with them the techniques of pottery making".

Song said if they managed to prove that large numbers of people came to the city from the river basin in the Hunan and Hubei provinces four thousand years ago, researchers would then begin to study the effects of such migrations on the others already inhabiting the region.

hl.seg: 3 / Crime rates drop in the Chinese capital

p.seg: Beijing 23 December / Xinhua / The General Security Bureau in the Chinese Capital, Beijing, said that the crime rate in the city during the first eleven months of this year dropped by 3.8 percent compared to the same period last year.
There was a remarkable decrease in cases of theft and robbery, which dropped by 18.2 and 18.8 percent respectively during this period, while criminal cases that were solved rose by 21.6 percent.

The bureau said that the police have made a series of raids on various crimes since the beginning of the year, rooting out 3180 criminal gangs and arresting 1620 fugitives through the computer and the internet. 1800 cases of narcotics have been solved and 99400 grams confiscated. 5620 economic crime cases have been solved, and funds and goods amounting in value to 7.3 billion Yuan (880 million American dollars) have been returned.

hl.seg: 74/ An understanding memorandum between the Emirates and the Sultanate of Oman

p.seg: Abu Dhabi 23 December / Xinhua / The United Arab Emirates and the Sultanate of Oman today signed an understanding memorandum related to connecting the electricity networks in the two countries.

The Emirates News Agency said that the memorandum was signed by the Electricity and Water Minister, Humayd Bin Nasir Al-Uways, on the Emirates' side, and by the Minister of Housing, Electricity and Water in the Sultanate of Oman, Sheikh Sohayl Mostahayl Shamas, who is currently visiting the Emirates, on the Omani side. The signing took place during official discussions held between the delegations of the two countries in Abu Dhabi.

The Understanding memorandum included the establishment of dual connections between the electricity networks of the two countries, connecting the areas of Alwaset with Al-Ain, Khassab with Ghalila, Duba Al-Baya with Duba, and Madha with Kadfa.

The dual connection between the two electricity networks is expected to take place after the completion of the economic feasibility study and of the connecting ring between the areas of Shnas and Al-Fujaira, and Mahda and Muzaira. Each country will finance the works carried out for the project within its own territories, and the purchase price of energy will be decided according to a tariff agreed upon by both parties.
/ End of news item /

hl.seg: 88 / Sharon: Israel to reduce prospective 2002 budget by 1.4 billion dollars

p.seg: Jerusalem 23 December / Xinhua / Israeli Prime Minister speaking in a television interview broadcast this evening said that he would reduce the prospective budget for 2002 by 6.15 billion Shekels, equivalent to 1.4 billion American dollars.
Sharon said that the budget reduction, proposed by the Finance Ministry, is a bitter pill to swallow.
The Finance Minister announced today for the first time the reduction of interest rates by 2 points percent. The business sector has been expecting this step for a long time.
Sharon said, "It would have been much easier to give out to everybody, and it would have been much easier to say that there was something left to give out".
"But" he added, "things are not like this".
The Prime Minister warned of future difficulties, but he promised that his government "will do its best to help those who do not have".

He re-affirmed that the conflict with the Palestinians was responsible for a great part of the difficulties Israel was suffering from. He said that financial responsibility and economizing are inevitable if the country is to emerge from the slump.
This morning the Ministers received copies of the budget project, which included the proposed reduction aiming at avoiding an economic downturn.

The proposed budget reveals that the largest reduction, amounting to a billion Shekels, 230 million dollars, will come from the budget of the Ministry of Defense while all other Ministries will have reductions of 3 percent.

hl.seg: Hungary and Romania sign a statement on Hungarian ethnicity

p.seg: Budapest 23 December / Xinhua / Hungary and Romania signed on Saturday a statement of understanding, to resolve the disputes concerning Hungarian ethnic rights in Romania and the issues related to developing bilateral relations.

The local media said that the Hungarian Prime Minister, Viktor Orban, and his visiting Romanian counterpart, Adrian Nastase, had signed the document one week before the so-called "Status law" took effect. This law gives economic benefits to ethnic Hungarians living in neighboring countries.

This dispute came to the fore after the Hungarian Parliament had ratified the above-mentioned law on 19 June last. Romania, Slovakia and other concerned countries found the law to be ethnically discriminating against other citizens.
The new statement signed by the two countries states that all Romanian citizens enjoy equal work and treatment rights on Hungarian lands, regardless of their ethnicity or origins.

The statement also pointed out that the two sides would continue to pass regulations that aim at protecting ethnic minorities in accordance with relevant international and European laws. The two governments would develop their bilateral relations based on mutual understanding and good neighborly relations.
The statement also includes the means of resolving the problems of ethnic Hungarians living in Romania.

hl.seg: 66 / Bangladesh's Prime Minister hopes to bolster military cooperation with China

p.seg: Dacca 24 December / Xinhua / The Prime Minister of Bangladesh, Khaleda Zia, today expressed her hope of promoting the good relations and the cooperation between the armed forces of both Bangladesh and China in the coming years.

Khaleda Zia, who is also the country's Defense Minister, made this statement during the visit to her residence of a visiting Chinese military delegation made up of six members, headed by the Deputy Chief of the General Staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Lieutenant General Xiong Li.
The Prime Minister said that Bangladesh and China are friendly countries that enjoy very good cooperative relations in the political, economic and cultural fields.
She also added that through exchanges of high-level visits, the cooperation between the armed forces of the two countries would receive a further boost.

On his part, General Xiong said that the Chinese people's Liberation Army would continue its military cooperation with Bangladesh, and would exert efforts to promote good relations with the armed forces of Bangladesh towards a new stage in the new century.
The Chinese military delegation had arrived here on Saturday.

hl.seg: The Head of Bethlehem Municipality calls for permitting Arafat to go to the city

p.seg: Gaza 24 December / Xinhua / The Head of Bethlehem Municipality, Hanna Nasir, called upon the international community to put pressure on Israel to allow the Palestinian President, Yasser Arafat, to go to Bethlehem.

In an interview on Radio Monte Carlo, which can be received here, Hanna Nasir called upon the Christians of the international community to move fast to stop the siege of the city of Bethlehem. He said that Israeli forces have been besieging the city until now. Going out of the city was next to impossible and entering it was difficult.

The Head of the Municipality of Bethlehem also added that the Nativity square was almost empty of pilgrims, except for some Italian pilgrims who came to the city, no more than 120 of them. He pointed out that the pilgrims find the city almost deserted; a very different atmosphere from how it was previously.

hl.seg: The Japanese government ratifies the huge defense budget for the financial year 2002

p.seg: Tokyo 24 December / Xinhua / The Japanese government ratified today, Monday, the large defense budget totaling 4956 billion Japanese Yen, 38.4 American dollars, for the financial year 2002, starting from next April.

Kyodo News Agency said that this defense budget is considered higher than the earlier budget, the initial budget for the current financial year, which amounted to 4955.3 billion Yen, 38.39 billion dollars.
The Japanese budget totaled 4.9 trillion Yen, 37.9
billion dollars, in the last six years.

The defense budget for the financial year 2002 will cover the purchase by Japan for the first time of an air-fueling plane and anti-biological attack equipment, in addition to the construction of a high-tech communications network for the Defense Agency.
The price of the air-fueling plane, a Boeing 767 costing 24.1 billion Yen, 186.8 million dollars, will be paid over a period of 5 years starting from the financial year 2002.
It is expected to go into actual service in the financial year 2006 approximately.

Kyodo News Agency said that the budget will devote 17.5 billion Yen, 135.6 million dollars, to confronting biological attacks. This is the equivalent of almost three times the amount of 6.4 billion Yen, 49.6 million dollars, which was dedicated to the same purpose in the initial budget for the financial year 2001.

It also added that the budget devotes 2.1 billion Yen, 16.3 million dollars, as a first installment to the Naval Self-Defense forces, for the purchase of a destroyer equipped with an advanced air-defense system costing 147 billion Yen, 1.14 billion dollars.

hl.seg: 70 / Heavy snowfall brings chaos to traffic in Germany

p.seg: Berlin 25 December / Xinhua / Heavy snowfall caused traffic chaos in large parts of Germany today.
In the eastern states of Saxony and Thuringen, many cars were stuck for hours in massive snow before rescuers managed to help them out.
Traffic men had to work all night on Christmas Eve to remove masses of snow covering railway tracks and highways.
Despite valiant efforts, many places in the Urzgebirge area were inaccessible today. Some parts of the highways were also closed.

The Police said that many accidents occurred consecutively. The victims were no fewer than six people, including three young men killed because of their failure to maneuver their car while overtaking the vehicle ahead of them on a snow-covered highway in the city of Munich.
Gottfried Marx from the Traffic Guidance Center in the city of Dresden in the East described the state of the traffic as "catastrophic", pointing out that the situation would now begin to ease.
Snowfall and gale winds increased the dangers of glacial collapse in the Alp region in the southern state of Bavaria.
The Glacial Collapse Warning Center said that the snow cover was extremely obstructive and warned skiers of straying away from defined skiing tracks.
In the state of North Rhine, North Westphalia, a large number of trees fell because of heavy snowfall, which led to the complete stoppage of electricity supply in some parts of the state.

hl.seg: 17/ Israel: Arafat will not leave Ramallah unless he arrests the Zeevi killers

p.seg: Jerusalem 25 December / Xinhua / Israeli officials in the Prime Minister's office said that the Palestinian leader Yasser Arafat would not be allowed to leave the city of Ramallah in the West Bank unless the killers of Tourism Minister, Rachavam Zeevi, were arrested. This was broadcast on Radio Israel today, Tuesday.
The Israeli Environment Minister, who belongs to the hawks of the Likud Party, said that Arafat would not leave Ramallah unless the killers of Zeevi, who was assassinated in October, were arrested.
Prime Minister Arial Sharon said yesterday that his permission for Arafat to go to Bethlehem to attend Christmas celebrations was conditional on the Palestinian leader's arrest of Zeevi's killers.
Right wing and left wing Israeli politicians criticized Sharon's decision.
In spite of international and local pressures, the Israeli government insisted on preventing Arafat from traveling to Bethlehem to attend Christmas celebrations yesterday.
In response, Arafat, in a television speech to his people last evening, said that Israel was guilty of stopping him from making his annual visit to Bethlehem for Christmas celebrations.

Arafat said, "The crime of depriving me of the right to participate in celebrating the birth of Christ will not in any way affect my determination, or the determination of our people, to continue on the path of a just and permanent peace".
Radio Israel said that the United States suggested to the Israeli Embassy in Washington that Israel should allow Arafat to attend Christmas mass in Bethlehem.

hl.seg: Argentina suspends foreign debt payment

p.seg: Buenos Aires 25 December /Xinhua / The Interim Argentine Government issued a statement on Monday suspending immediately the payment of interests and original foreign debt amounts estimated at 132 billion American dollars.

This step, which is considered the largest suspension of its kind in history, comes as part of a series of new economic measures announced by the temporary Argentine President, Adolfo Rodriguez Saa, after he was sworn in as the new leader of the country Sunday morning.

Rodriguez Saa, who took over the temporary office of President after the resignation of the former President, Fernando Delaroi, last Friday on account of the tremendous social anarchy that overtook the country in protest against the tight-fisted economic policies of his government, said, "This does not mean refusing to pay foreign debts...
But it's the government's first reasonable step towards dealing with the problem of foreign debts".

The government's statement issued on Monday said that Argentina took this step "because of the continuing economic slump, in addition to the absence of international capital, which caused the obstruction of general financing and the creation of problems for Argentina".

The statement also promised to conduct quick talks with debtors on the re-scheduling of debts, saying, "This is an integral part of a permanent and comprehensive plan to boost the Argentine economy and revive the country".

hl.seg: Israel: Stopping Arafat from going to Bethlehem is due to the fight against terrorism

p.seg: / First and last addition /

The Israeli Foreign Ministry spokesman, Ovir Goldmann, claimed in his statements that he was not stopped because he is a Moslem, but because he did not hand over to Israel the killers of Israel's Tourism Minister, Rachavam Zeevi. They are elements from the Popular Front, and Arafat knows quite well who they are. Israel wants them handed over before giving Arafat permission to travel to the city of Bethlehem.
The spokesman also claimed that the decision to stop Arafat from going to Bethlehem was a symbolic gesture, giving Arafat the red signal to fight terrorism in a serious manner.

Ovir Goldmann pointed out that Israel has not yet seen any serious actions taken by the Palestinian National Authority against the infrastructure of what he called Palestinian terrorism, including the movements of Hamas and Islamic Jihad.

Ovir Goldmann went on to say, "In order for us to be convinced of Arafat's seriousness, he has to fight terrorism in a more serious manner. This is the reason behind the decision to stop Arafat from going to Bethlehem".

hl.seg: Two Peruvians suspected of involvement in car explosion in Bolivia

p.seg: Lima 25 December / Xinhua / A spokesman for the Bolivian Crime Police said on Monday that two Peruvian nationals are at the top of the list of suspects, thought to be involved in the explosion of a booby-trapped car in front of a Police building in the Province of Santa Cruz in East Bolivia.

It is believed that the two Peruvian suspects, Wilfredo Yoweri and Wilfredo Camana, are former members of the Road of Light movement, an armed rebel group that has been fighting the Peruvian security forces since the eighties.

It should be pointed out that the booby-trapped car exploded last Friday in front of a Police station in the Province of Santa Cruz, the second largest province in Bolivia, leading to the death of one person and the injury of at least 12 more people. The 10-storey Police building was seriously damaged.

hl.seg: Chinese scientists succeed in making a rational robot hand

p.seg: Beijing 25 December / Xinhua / Chinese scientists made a robot's hand, the same size as a reasonable human adult's hand and containing four fingers.
The robot's hand, believed to comply with international standards, has taken a leading position among Chinese robots. It was designed and made by scientists at the Harbin Professional University.
The hand is supplied with 96 sensory tools and hundreds of mechanical and electrical components. It has four joints in each finger and can play light musical pieces through computer control.
It can also perform more difficult tasks, such as pouring water out of a thermos through a remote control.
A Chinese academic said that the rational robot's hand, which is endowed with sensory perception and remote control functions, has filled a gap in robot research in China.

hl.seg: The first tunnel for the Tibet Region on the Qinghai-Tibet railway line

p.seg: Lahsa 25 December / Xinhua / The digging operation for the tunnel, Leo Woo, on the Qinghai-Tibet railway line was completed yesterday, Monday.
This is the first Tibet Region tunnel on the railway line across the Qinghai-Tibet plateau.

This tunnel lies at a distance of 13 km from the city of Lahsa, the capital of the Tibet Autonomous Region, which is well known by the name "roof of the world". It is 411 km long and more than 4000 m high above sea level.
It should be pointed out that the Tibet Region along the Qinghai-Tibet railway line is about 548 km long.
Currently, four tunnels are being constructed along this region in a smooth manner.

hl.seg: 10 thousand elderly University students study at Tianjin Tianjin 26 December / Xinhua / 15,000 old-age students study at the University of Tianjin for the elderly in the North of China. Half of these students are aged 70 or more.
Most of them are retired people, from intellectuals, professionals, workers and government officials.

p.seg: These old people worked hard in their youth and had no time to satisfy their wishes and inclinations.
They had the opportunity of joining University after retirement.
The Tianjin University for the Elderly was established in 1985.

When it first started, it offered the subjects of National Handwriting and Drawing, Literature and History. Now it offers 97 disciplines, including the English and Japanese languages, Computer and Friendship Dances.
During the first stage of its establishment, the elderly joined the University at the annual rate of 500.
Now, however, more than 4000 join it every year.

The University has decided to admit more students next year, especially in the English Language Department because the elderly are enthusiastic about studying this language after China had joined the world Trade Organization.

hl.seg: First car company defines its goals for the year 2005

p.seg: Jingdezhen 26 December / Xinhua / The first Chinese car company, the cradle of the car manufacturing industry in China, has pledged to manufacture and sell 700 thousand cars annually by the year 2005.

According to the Company's long-term plans, its sale revenues are expected to total 85 billion Yuan, 10.24 billion American dollars, and the profits after tax deduction to total 4 billion Yuan by the year 2005.

In comparing the year 2000 with the year 1991, it becomes clear that the company's car production increased 4.6 times and sale revenues 9.1 times, while profits after tax deduction increased 32.5 times.
China did not have any car factories before the construction of this company in 1953.

hl.seg: Rural health conditions in an autonomous region

p.seg: / First and last addition / Guangxi laid down "practical regulations for health services in public institutions in Guangxi" last May. It invested more than 100 million Yuan in repairing and building the essential utilities of most rural centers within its boundaries.

Guangxi is also active in organizing reciprocal assistance between the medical and health staff. 142 medical and health institutions of varying levels have offered assistance to 71 rural health centers in poor and border areas consisting of manpower, equipment, management and training.

Furthermore, Guangxi has also been active in building a health insurance system for farmers. A cooperative medical treatment system was set up, covering more than 13,000 villages, representing 90 percent of the total number of villages in the region.

hl.seg: 40/ Ten people killed in road accident in southwestern China

p.seg: Chengdu 26 December / Xinhua / A bus crashed into a parked truck on a highway in southwestern China, leaving 10 persons killed and 18 injured on 24 December.
The local Police said that the accident took place in the Jiangyang section of the Chengdu-Chongqing highway.
Police sources said that the truck, which had been overloaded with 9 tons of coal, in effect double its capacity, stopped in a lane after one of its tires went flat.
A few minutes later, it was hit by a bus carrying 28 passengers.
Police and traffic officers in the area rushed to the place of the accident to take part in the rescue operations.

Preliminary investigations revealed that the two drivers were to blame, because the truck driver failed to give any warning signal after the tire went flat, while the bus driver did not act properly in the face of this danger.

hl.seg: 5/ Iraq tries to expand its economic relations with the Emirates

p.seg: Baghdad 26 December / Xinhua / A weekly Iraqi newspaper said that Iraq had taken many steps as part of its attempt to develop its economic and industrial relations with the United Arab Emirates.

Al-E'lam newspaper published here today said that Iraq signed contracts with more than 12 industrial companies from the Emirates for supplying different buildings and projects with their various industrial needs. It pointed out that one of these companies supplied some Iraqi projects and laboratories with the equipment they needed, in addition to reserve car equipment.

The newspaper explained that an unnamed Emirates company supplied Iraq with special drilling equipment. It added that there were other agreements to sign new contracts in the fields of industry and free trade, which was signed recently between Iraq and the Emirates.

It should be pointed out that the Emirates is the first Gulf state to sign a free trade agreement with Iraq. This agreement was signed on the second of last November and the Emirates government ratified it at the end of last month. Iraqi markets currently have a great number of goods and products from, or imported via, the Emirates.

Sheikh Zayed Bin Salman Al Nahayan, Head of the Arab Emirates state, had called several times for the lifting of the sanctions imposed on Iraq and the return of Iraq to the Arab fold, for forgetting the past and opening a new page. The Emirates re-opened its embassy in Baghdad last year and the relations between the two sides are developing continually.

hl.seg: 50 / Illegal emigrants arrested in the English Channel tunnel

p.seg: London 26 December / Xinhua / British Police said today that it arrested about 150 illegal emigrants trying to cross the English Channel tunnel connecting between France and Britain, on Christmas Day.
The trains were stopped for ten hours after these emigrants had broken through the fence and walked on foot almost a quarter of the road into the tunnel.

The company in charge of operating the tunnel, Eurotunnel, said that the French anti-riot police used tear gas to force 400 more to go back. The emigrants later tried to storm a Calais center in their attempt to overpower French security in their attempt to cross illegally to Britain.

The 150 emigrants who stormed into the tunnel at 20:15 GMT on Christmas Day are considered the fourth group of asylum seekers to try to find their way on foot through the tunnel in less than 5 months.
The Eurotunnel Company says that it has intercepted 18,500 infiltrators during the first half of this year, most of whom live in Sangatte in France.

hl.seg: 13 people killed in Morocco because of floods

p.seg: Rabat 26 December / Xinhua / Five people were killed in floods caused by the torrential rains falling on the city of Essaouria since last Sunday. Essaouria lies on the Atlantic Ocean, about 370 km to the South of Rabat.

A report coming Tuesday evening from the city of Essaouria, based on a statement by the Essaouria Royal Water Works Authority, said that traffic had stopped on some roads because of the collapse of a number of dams. Floodwaters also carried a number of animals towards the coast.
The floods resulting from torrential rains left eight people dead in the city of Settat and caused grave losses in property.
Floods and heavy rainfall also caused serious damage to other parts of the country. The number of rain flood victims has risen to at least 13 people until now.

hl.seg: Brazil records highest illiteracy rates among Mercosur countries

p.seg: Brasilia 26 December / Xinhua / Illiteracy among Brazilians reached 12.8 percent in the year 2000, the highest level in the South Common Market area, Mercosur, despite a drop of 7 percent compared to the last decade, according to the report of the Brazilian authorities published on Tuesday.
The Geographical Historical Institute in Brazil reported that last year's figures were less than 10 percent among the other Mercosur member states, which are Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay.
The rural areas in Brazil achieved the highest rates of illiteracy reduction, with the rate dropping to 59.9 percent from 72.2 percent in 1990.

hl.seg: Venezuela demands the extradition of an accused Cuban fugitive

p.seg: Caracas 26 December / Xinhua / Venezuela intends to demand that the Panamanian authorities hand over an accused Cuban fugitive, responsible for attacking a commercial Cuban flight in 1976, according to a statement by the Venezuelan Foreign Minister, Luis Alfonso Davilar, on Tuesday.
Davilar explained that he was waiting for the document, which the Venezuelan Supreme Court is expected to issue, to demand the handing over of the accused, Luis Posada.
Posada was arrested last year in Panama because of his involvement in the attempt to assassinate the Cuban leader, Fidel Castro, during the tenth Ibero-American Summit.
In 1985, Posada escaped from the Venezuelan prison where he was serving a 20-year sentence for having attacked a Cuban aircraft in 1976.
The aircraft had on board 73 people, most of whom were Cuban sports people returning home from international competitions.

hl.seg: World economic news in brief / A first and last addition /

p.seg: Cairo: The President of the Arab Monetary Fund, Jasim Al-Mana'i, stated here today, Tuesday, that the Fund had signed with the Egyptian Central Bank two agreements. According to these agreements, the Fund will offer Egypt loans of 152.5 million American dollars to help it face the negative economic effects it suffered from in the wake of the American September 11 events.
The first agreement will provide an automatic loan of 91.5 million American dollars.

This loan will be devoted to helping with the probable deficit in the balance of payments caused by the latest global economic developments, which left a negative effect on all the countries of the world and not on Egypt alone.
Concerning the second agreement, it involves a compensation loan of 61 million dollars, which aims at helping deal with any irregularities in the balances of payments.

hl.seg: Attracting foreign investments in a Chinese province

p.seg: Xining 28 December / Xinhua / The correspondent learnt form the Economics and Foreign Trade Authority in the Qinghai Province in West China that the Province has attracted 198 million American dollars of foreign investments so far this year, thus recording the highest figure in its history.
There are seven institutions in the Province with investments exceeding 10 million American dollars each.
The institutions funded by foreign investments alone totaled 14 out of the 46 institutions that have been approved this year.
Foreign investments, coming from more than 30 countries and regions, were distributed among agricultural industries, raising and producing livestock, textiles, energy, mining and real estate.
An official explained that the rapid increase of foreign investments was due to preference policies and the improved atmosphere for investment.

hl.seg: 18 / Iraqi Vice President receives Tunisian Trade Minister

p.seg: Baghdad 27 December / Xinhua / Iraqi Vice President, Taha Yasin Ramadan, reiterated the necessity of boosting relations between Iraq and Tunisia and of putting into effect the free trade agreement signed between the two countries.

According to the official Iraqi News Agency, during Ramadan's reception of the Tunisian Trade Minister, Al-Tahar Sioud, he is reported as saying, "Arab cooperation is considered the only means of boosting the economy of the Arab World and developing it for the better". He added, "The free trade agreements signed between Iraq and each of Egypt, Syria, Tunisia, Algeria and the Emirates constitute the seed of the Arab Common Market, which Arabs hope to bring about. He pointed out that the relations between Iraq and Tunisia are deep, and extend far into history.

The Agency pointed out that the Tunisian Minister re-affirmed during the meeting that the free trade agreement signed between Iraq and Tunisia will contribute to promoting economic and commercial cooperation between the two countries.

It should be pointed out that the Iraqi Trade Minister, Mohamed Mahdi Saleh, had announced the day before yesterday that the agreement to establish a free trade zone between Iraq and Tunisia has entered the phase of implementation as of last Tuesday 25 December, after it had officially been ratified in both Iraq and Tunisia.

hl.seg: 4 / Most Palestinians support resumption of negotiations with Israel

p.seg: Jerusalem 27 December / Xinhua / An opinion poll indicated that the great majority of Palestinians support a cease-fire with Israel and wish for the resumption of Palestinian-Israeli negotiations, which aim at reaching a political settlement.

The poll, carried out by the Palestinian Center for Political Studies and Research, revealed that no fewer than 71% support the resumption of negotiations with Israel, while 60% agree to the cease-fire announced by President Arafat in the fifth month of the Intifada.

On the other hand, 76% of Palestinians expressed their protest at the arrest by Palestinian Police of extremist Palestinians. 61% expressed their belief that armed confrontations allowed Palestinians to score points in their struggle to gain their rights.

The poll also indicated that the most popular Palestinian personalities in order of popularity are as follows: President Yasser Arafat (36%), Sheikh Ahmad Yasin, the spiritual leader of Hamas movement (14%), Marwan Al-Barghouthi, the Secretary of the Fattah movement in the West Bank (11%).
The poll was conducted in the territories of the West Bank and the Gaza Strip between 19 and 24 December. It included a representative sample of 1357 persons, with a margin of error estimated at 3%.

hl.seg: China closes down all the markets of pirated audiovisual products

p.seg: Beijing 28 December / Xinhua / Actions of closing down all pirated audiovisual products markets in China have been accomplished, terminating the situation in which pirated products had dominated the market.
These actions lasted for three years, during which 277 markets were closed down.
Each of these markets included more than ten commercial stores, distributed over 27 provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities.
The Chinese Ministry of Culture decided in 1999 to close down these markets in a gradual manner.
The local governments had set up schedules for the implementation of these actions.
During the current year, 216 markets, in which pirated audiovisual products were sold, were closed down.

Deputy Director of the Marketing Department in the Ministry of Culture, Chang Jian Shen, pointed out that combating piracy contributes to the manufacturing of legitimate products, and the boom of the Chinese audiovisual products industry.

It is worth mentioning that at the same time when China is clamming down with full force on piracy, it is also promoting the establishment of distribution centers and chain stores for legitimate audiovisual products, and their sale via the internet.

hl.seg: China specifies a new direction for using foreign investments

p.seg: Second Addition / The State Committee for Development Planning added that multinational corporations can contribute directly to the strategic restructuring and reform of the institutions owned by the State.

China will choose a group of these institutions, particularly the major ones that have been transformed into corporations, or are now in the process of being transformed. Some of the shares of these corporations will be sold to foreign investors according to plan. Foreigners may control the majority of shares of institutions, with the exception of important Chinese institutions involved in state security or the arteries of economic life.
China will choose a group of major institutions, which comply with conditions for registration in the stock exchange, and will offer them gradually in the international stock exchange markets.
China encourages multinational corporations and local institutions to achieve cooperation and strategic integration of capital, to increase the percentage of multinational corporate investments.

hl.seg: Proposing projects to attract foreign investments in a Chinese Province

p.seg: Shijiazhuang 29 December / Xinhua / According to the Committee for Development Planning in the Hebei Province, North China, this province will propose a number of projects for attracting foreign investments during the year 2002. These will include seven sectors, the most important of which are: the agricultural industry, the improvement of traditional sectors and raising their standards, and new high-tech manufacturing.

An official in this committee stated that agricultural industry involves the implementation of projects dealing with the treatment of vegetables, fruits and animal produce, and the development of an unpolluted food production base.

This province will work towards attracting new high technologies next year, in order to improve traditional sectors and raise their standards in the fields of iron and steel, medicine, food, machinery, chemicals and construction materials, as well as improve a new line of products that are treated in-depth and are of high technological content.

As for the new high-tech industry domain, this province seeks to achieve a new breakthrough in the fields of electronic information industry, bio-engineering, new traditional Chinese medicine, new materials, and environmental protection, through attracting foreign investments and minds.

In addition, Hebei Province will become active in attracting foreign investments during the coming year, to develop projects related to the protection and construction of the environment, the treatment of pollution, combating desertification, infrastructure installations, education, culture, and public health.

hl.seg: Selections from Beijing newspapers / First and final addition /

p.seg: Xinhua Daily Telegraph stated that China has held on to its commitments towards the World Trade Organization through the reinforcement of laws, regulations and policies.

China Youth Daily stated that the Head of Government, Premier Zhu Rongji, said in a national meeting on Friday that China will work towards the modification of its strategies in order to develop the Science, Technology and Education sectors.

Quangming Daily stated that farmers in a mountainous village in Shaanxi Province have recently erected a statue for a professor who had helped them break free of the shackles of poverty through the cultivation of medicinal herbs.
China Daily stated that the Chinese Civil Aviation Authority will reduce the special oil taxes exacted on plane tickets as of the first of next January.

hl.seg: Jordan invites India and Pakistan to end escalation and resume the dialogue between them

p.seg: Amman 28 December / Xinhua / Jordan invited India and Pakistan to end escalation, resume dialogue and work towards resolving all disputes between them through political means.

Jordanian Foreign Minister, Abdul Ilah Al-Khatib, said in a press statement this evening in Amman, that "Jordan, considering its close relations with the two friendly countries, and Arab relations with them, invites the governments of Pakistan and India to undertake the necessary procedures towards ending the escalation witnessed during the last few days. This escalation gives warning signals of a military confrontation threatening world security and stability".

Al-Khatib added that Jordan stresses the importance of exerting efforts to reinstate the language of dialogue, and to try to resolve any differences peacefully, in accordance with the principles of the United Nations Charter, in order to save the two countries from the dangers of escalation and confrontation.

hl.seg: Final results of elections in Zambia expected tomorrow Saturday

p.seg: Lusaka 28 December / Xinhua / Zambian election committee anticipated this evening that presidential, parliamentary and local election results will be announced early Saturday morning.
The head of the committee, Dani Calali, stated that the full results will be announced after receiving all polling boxes from all over the country.

Calali also said, "Until now some polling cards have not been received from the polling centers, and all votes will be pooled in Lusaka after all the polling boxes have been received. It is possible that the committee will announce the full results early tomorrow morning, Saturday, in Lusaka".
Voting had been postponed in some areas of the country because of logistical problems such as the unavailability of voting cards.
Zambians are worried about who will be the lucky final winner: Levy Mwanawasa of the ruling Multi Party Democratic Movement, or Anderson Mazoka of the United Party for National Development.
Mazoka is considered to be slightly ahead of Mwanawasa, since most of the awaited results will come from the areas of his political influence in south Zambia.

hl.seg: The formation of a joint technical committee between Ethiopia and Yemen

p.seg: Addis Ababa 28 December / Xinhua / According to an Ethiopian News Agency report, Ethiopia and Yemen set up today a joint technical committee to help the implementation of the Cooperation Agreement signed by the two states, especially in the fields of gas and mineral exploration.

Ethiopian State Minister for Mines, Sinkinish Igigo, said in the joint technical committee meeting that setting up this committee was undertaken on the basis of the agreement on the implementation program signed by the two parties last February.
She said that the formation of this committee will play a decisive role in reinforcing bilateral relations between the two countries.
The agreement states that both Ethiopia and Yemen encourage their respective private sectors to enter joint investment projects in the domain of developing mines.
Yemeni Deputy Minister for Oil and Mineral Resources, Abdel Malek Mohammed Alama, expressed his government's desire to strengthen relations with Ethiopia in the mine development sector.
Alama arrived here yesterday, Thursday, at the head of a Yemeni delegation consisting of five members, on a business visit to Ethiopia for five days.

hl.seg: Norway affirms its desire to implement peace in Sri Lanka

p.seg: Colombo 28 December / Xinhua / Norway replied positively to the Sri Lankan request concerning the resumption of its role in the peace process in the war-torn country.

The official newspaper, Daily News, mentioned today, Friday, that a press statement was issued by the Norwegian Prime Minister's Office Thursday night, stating that the Norwegian Prime Minister, Kjell Magne Boondevik, expressed his country's wish to resume the role of mediator accepted by the Sri Lankan government and the Tamil Tigers Separatist Rebels.

He expressed this wish after a long telephone conversation with his Sri Lankan counterpart, Ranil Wickramesinghe, who made an official request to Norway to resume its mediation in the ongoing process of trying to resolve the ethnic dispute which has been going on for the last eighteen years in north and east Sri Lanka.
Wickramesinghe said in a press conference on Wednesday that the Indian government also welcomed the Norwegian role in the peace process.

hl.seg: A boost in the exports of Chinese light industrial products

p.seg: Beijing 29 December / Xinhua / The Head of the Chinese Light Industry Union, Chin She Ning, said that the volume of Chinese light industry exports has reached 61.799 billion American dollars during the January-October period of the current year, with an increase of 4.86 percent, compared to the equivalent period last year, achieving 40 billion American dollars of trade surplus.
The total volume of exports is expected to reach 74 billion American dollars annually, with an increase of 4.5 percent.
It has been reported that Chinese light industries have realized 1576.384 billion Yuan for the industrial sector in the first ten months of this year.
This is expected to total 1.9 trillion Yuan by the end of the year, with an increase of 14.5 percent annually.

These light industries also realized 127.553 billion Yuan in pre-tax profits during this period. Pre-tax profits are expected to reach 154 billion Yuan by the end of the year, with an increase of 15 percent.
The two indicators mentioned above occupied a third of the total national industrial produce and the total pre-tax industrial profits respectively.

Chen also set down the goal for the economic performance of light industries in the coming year: increasing economic added value by 12 percent, exceeding the rate of product marketing by 98 percent, increasing the volume of exports by 2 percent, and profits to reach 80 billion Yuan.

hl.seg: Russia invites further cooperation with independent oil producers

p.seg: Moscow 29 December / Xinhua / Deputy Minister for Energy, Oleg Gordiev, said here today that Russia urges non-OPEC oil exporters to continue their cooperation in working to promote the stability of the international oil market, taking into consideration the interests of both consumers and producers.

The Deputy Minister said, "We have to cooperate with OPEC in finding a way to work towards the stability of oil prices. We need to have a good understanding of any measures that may touch the interests of many participants in the market".
Gordiev mentioned that Russia respects and supports OPEC measures, yet it affirms, on the other hand, that "Russia has commitments towards supplying European consumers with oil".
He also added that Russia, Norway, Mexico, Oman, and Angola supported the OPEC initiative of raising oil prices, and declared a reduction of their raw oil exports by 150,000 barrels a day.
He also added that the period of Russian reduction depends on changes occurring in the international oil market, and "our general understanding of its level of stability".

OPEC had declared yesterday in its emergency session held in Cairo that it will reduce oil production by 1.5 million barrels a day for six months, as of January 2002, after having received commitments from five non-member states to reduce their production by 462500 barrels a day.
Russia announced yesterday that it welcomed the resolution.

hl.seg: 35/ Eighteen Indian soldiers killed in a border maneuver

p.seg: New Delhi 29 December / Xinhua / Indian Press Trust News Agency said today, Saturday, that 18 Indian army soldiers were killed in an explosion which occurred during maneuvers on the Indian-Pakistani border of the Rajasthan State, West of India.

The News Agency quoted an official report reaching the headquarters in Jaisalmer Region that the tragic incident occurred yesterday, Friday, on the border between Longjual and Sadiola, resulting in the immediate death of the soldiers.
The agency added that the soldiers were undergoing training on how to deactivate land mines when the incident occurred.
It also added that the blast was heard for a distance of kilometers, causing panic in the border villages.
The agency indicated that Defense sources refused to reveal further details about the incident and the number of casualties.

hl.seg: Zambian ruling party candidate achieves early head start in presidential elections

p.seg: Lusaka 28 December / Xinhua / Zambian election committee said this evening that the Zambian ruling party candidate, Levy Mwanawasa, has achieved an early head start in Presidential elections.

The election committee said that the initial official results in seven electoral areas out of a total of 150 areas indicate that 36121 votes have been given to Mwanawasa, versus 17089 votes to the businessman Anderson Mazoka of the United Party for National Development.
The governmental television, which broadcast the results in four other areas, gave Mwanawasa 47403 votes versus 23507 votes for Mazoka.

The opposition candidate, Godfrey Miyanda, on the other hand, occupied third place, having gained 22943 votes, followed by Christon Tembo, of the Forum for Democracy and Development, who gained 16882 votes.
It is worth noting that the new president will succeed President Frederic Chiluba, who resigns ten years after the return of multi-parties to Zambia.

hl.seg: The resignation of an Argentine interim government official

p.seg: Buenos Aires 29 December / Xinhua / Reports here today said that the Chief Adviser to the Interim Argentine President, Adolfo Rodriguez, will hand in his resignation early Saturday morning, in the wake of large protest demonstrations on the streets of the capital.

The President's Adviser, Louis Loskinos, affirmed earlier today that the President has accepted the resignation of Carlos Grosso, Chief Adviser to the President, who resigned hours after the beginning of protest demonstrations.

Thousands of people in all parts of the Capital took to the streets late last night and this morning, demonstrating against the appointment of allegedly corrupt officials in the government, and against the ongoing restrictions on withdrawals from bank accounts.

hl.seg: Cardoso and Bush discuss the situation in Argentina

p.seg: Brasilia 29 December / Xinhua / Brazilian President, Fernando Henrique Cardoso, held a telephone conversation on Friday with his American counterpart, George Walker Bush, discussing the current political and economic situation in Argentina.

Alexander Parola, Assistant to Brazilian Presidency spokesman, declared to journalists that both presidents agree on the "necessity" of solidarity and providing support to the efforts of reviving the economy in Argentina.
During the conversation, Bush pointed out that he tried to contact Cardoso Thursday, on board the presidential Air Force One, but his attempts were fruitless.

The American President held telephone talks Thursday with the Mexican President, Vicente Fox, the Chilean President, Ricardo Lagos, and the Uruguayan President, Jorge Battle, and discussed the situation in Argentina.

hl.seg: The Philippines, Indonesia and Malaysia sign a draft agreement for combating terrorism

p.seg: Manila 29 December / Xinhua / Officials in the Philippines, Indonesia and Malaysia ratified a draft agreement aiming at combating terrorism and crimes across the borders. The draft agreement also includes measures to promote international communications and the formation of joint rapid response forces.

The Philippine Star newspaper said today, Saturday, that the agreement that was ratified Friday included cooperation in the domains of fighting terrorism, money laundering, smuggling, piracy, hijacking, illegal immigration, marine pollution, weapon trafficking, and other crimes.

An agreement was reached here on Friday, at the end of the two-day conference attended by the Deputy Foreign Ministers of the three countries suffering currently from some extremist activities. Brunei and Thailand sent monitors to the meeting.
The Foreign Ministers of the three states will discuss, and probably sign, the document during their annual meeting to be held in Fukit, Thailand, at the beginning of next year.
The draft agreement calls for a system that determines how security forces are to cooperate in these countries to combat border crimes.
The draft also calls for the formation of a joint committee to monitor the implementation of the agreement and to establish contacts with the Heads of States.

hl.seg: The construction of six new bases for the manufacturing of micro-chemicals in a Chinese Province

p.seg: Shenyang 30 December / Xinhua / Liaoning Province in northeastern China, the Chinese province with the largest number of traditional industries, plans to build six bases for manufacturing micro-chemicals.
It will invest more than 3 billion Yuan in the field of manufacturing micro-chemicals during the next five years.
In the coming five years, Liaoning Province will achieve new points of growth in five fields of chemicals, by benefiting from its unique resources, technologies, and products.

These five fields include the following: first, developing micro-chemical products such as Boride, and fire-preventives containing Boron, by using Liaoning's superiority in the extractable raw resources of Boron, which locally constitute about 90 percent of the national total.

Second, concentrating on developing high-tech products, such as intermediary materials for medicine and dyes, by using Liaoning's superiority in petroleum and tar resources, and raw organic materials.
Third, concentrating on developing new catalytic materials, by using Liaoning's first-rate, world-class equipment and technologies, both imported and locally developed.
Fourth, concentrating on spreading paint technologies, increasing the effectiveness of chemical fertilizers and developing highly-effective low-toxic insecticides.
Fifth, concentrating on developing and applying the new generation of compound materials, in order to diversify the products of Compounded Rating, such as polythene and polypropylene.
During the past five years, the petrochemical sector of Liaoning Province has developed more than 700 kinds of micro-chemicals. The value of products increased by about 2 billion Yuan.

hl.seg: The first station for observing the marine environment of coral reefs in China

p.seg: Beihai 30 December / Xinhua / A few days ago, the first Chinese station for observing the marine environment of coral reefs was established on Wichou Island, off the Beihai coastal city in the Guangxi Zhung Autonomous Region in South China.

It should be pointed out that coral reefs, known as "the rainy equatorial forests of the seas", are the most important marine habitat, and the most distinctive marine eco-system of biological diversity in the world.
They are highly valuable for protecting marine ecological balance, reinforcing sea coasts and islands, conducting scientific research, developing tourism, and for marine production.
Wichou Island, with an area of 25 km2, lies at a distance of 36 sea miles from Beihai city.
It is surrounded by coral reefs as large as the island itself, and consisting of about 30 different rare kinds of coral reef resources in China.

This station is directly affiliated to the National Chinese Sea Authority, and will be working in accordance with the internationally recognized methods and standards of observation. It will conduct long-term examinations of the healthy growth of coral reefs, establish a data bank of the observed coral reef environments, and provide technical support for the construction of a Wichou Island Nature Reserve for the coral reef environment.

hl.seg: 34/ A meeting between the princes of Bahrain and Qatar

p.seg: Masqat 30 December / Xinhua / Sheikh Hamad Bin Isa Al Khalifa, Prince of Bahrain, met in Masqat this afternoon with Sheikh Hamad Bin Khalifa Al Thani, Prince of Qatar, on the margins of the 22nd summit for the leaders of the Gulf States Cooperation Council, which is due to open later today.

During the meeting, the princes of Bahrain and Qatar exchanged friendly conversations on the good and distinctive relations between the two countries and peoples, and the progress these relations are experiencing in all domains.

The two princes also reviewed the topics to be discussed in the Masqat summit, in an attempt to formulate a unified Gulf stand regarding all the issues to be discussed by the leaders of the Gulf Cooperation Council States during their summit. The summit will deal with consolidating the frameworks for cooperation and coordination in the political, economic, defense, and security domains.
The two princes also discussed a number of recent developments in the region.

The meeting between the princes of Bahrain and Qatar comes in the wake of solving the border dispute that had existed between the two countries for 60 years, concerning areas very rich in oil and gas, which almost resulted in military conflict in 1986. The International Court of Justice in The Hague had issued its verdict last March concerning the dispute between the two countries, declaring Qatar's sovereignty over Ficht el-Deeble, Zbara, and Jenan Island, and Bahrain's sovereignty over the Hewar Islands and Jerada region.
The princes of Bahrain and Qatar had arrived in Masqat earlier today to head the delegations of their countries at the summit.

hl.seg: 71/ The volume of trade between Thailand and Laos continues its increase

p.seg: Bangkok 30 December / Xinhua / The Central Bank declared here today that bilateral trade between Thailand and Laos has continued its accelerated growth during this year, despite the global economic recession.

The volume of trade between the two countries has totaled 423.4 million dollars for the whole year, with an increase of 7.7 percent compared to the year 2000, according to a report issued by the Bank of London.
The report stated that the Thai products exported to Laos were mostly consumer goods, including electrical appliances, cars, construction materials, clothes and capital products.

The Bank estimates that bilateral trade will witness a greater growth in the year 2002, in the light of the Thai government's actual agreement to apply the preference system to the Laos products imported into Thailand.

The Bank, however, indicated that Thai exporters are expected to face stronger competition in the Laos markets in the coming years, due to increasing competition from the products of other countries, particularly Singapore.

hl.seg: A news report ... China joins World Trade Organization and Protection of Intellectual Property Rights

p.seg: / First addition /
In the past two decades, China passed legislations concerning patents, trademarks, and copyrights, as well as other laws and legislations that deal with Intellectual Property Rights.
The three above-mentioned laws, which had been amended lately, are in accordance with the Agreement on Intellectual Property relating to trade.

Li Ming Deh, Professor at the Intellectual Property Center at the Chinese Academy for Social Sciences, said that this agreement guarantees creativity and the legitimate transfer of art among the members of the International Trade Organization, adding that Intellectual Property is of greatest value in the 21st century.

China lags behind developed countries in the percentage of research and development expenditure to gross national income, in the number of scientists and engineers per every 10 thousand persons, and in the number of patents per every 10,000 persons.
Li said that repetitive low-standard research has obstructed scientific and technological development in China.
Statistics show that the Japanese apply for more than 400,000 patents annually in their country and abroad.
Applications for patents in the United States amount to 200,000 and in Germany to 150,000 every year.

hl.seg: A long-term touristic plan in the southernmost part of China

p.seg: Haikou 1 January / Xinhua / The Province (Island) of Hainan, in the remotest southern part of China, has decided to become active in exploring touristic sites, and making tourism contribute more to the gross local income in the coming two decades.

According to the comprehensive plan for developing tourism in the Province, Hainan expects to receive 48 to 55 million tourists annually by the year 2020. The income from the tourism industry will then represent 15 percent of the total local income.

According to the plan, Hainan will concentrate its efforts on constructing 7 major tourist centers in major local cities, such as Haikou, Sanya, and Bowau, as well as such scenic sites as Wuxi Mountain.

hl.seg: Farmer mediators in Liaoning Province

p.seg: Shenyang 2 January / Xinhua / Increasing numbers of young trading farmer mediators have appeared in the Liaoning Province, in northeastern China. They are active between the south and north of the Yangzi River, the longest Chinese river, and are depending on their advanced farming skills and quick market information.

These mediators play an important role in the process of accelerating agricultural restructuring, expanding agricultural and subsidiary markets, and achieving prosperity for farmers in their homeland.

For instance, in the Governorate of Dawa, in Liaoning Province, the young farmer mediator Liu Kang markets more than 2000 kilograms of daily consumed mushrooms all over the Province, in accordance with agreements he had signed in 2001 with more than 50 local families concerning the cultivation of edible mushrooms.

In the same governorate, another young farmer mediator named Jin Hoi markets half a million kilograms of tomatoes annually outside the Province. He has succeeded in introducing some tomato products into Russian markets.
