It should be pointed out that the Governorate of Dawa is advanced in organic farming in China, and is renowned for its production of first-rate rice, aquatic products, and vegetables.
In this governorate, there are more than 200 such mediators, on governorate, district and village levels.

hl.seg: 15/ Most important news items in major Turkish papers

p.seg: Ankara 31 December / Xinhua / Following are the latest news items in major Turkish papers for Monday.
//Hurriyet// (Freedom):
Turkey has become poorer with the downturn of the economy by 9.2 percent in the year 2001.
The Turks are facing the greatest economic crisis since the end of World War Two.
//Milliyet// (The National):

The first goal of the Turkish government in 2002 will be to reduce the inflation rate, and strengthen the banking system. This came in the message sent by Kamal Darwish, the Turkish Minister of State, and Syria Surderjiji, the Governor of the Central Bank, to the International Monetary Fund.
// Turkish Daily News//:
The European Union's attitude to the fight against terrorism is still far from addressing Turkish sensitivities towards cooperation against terrorism.
It is worth noting that the European Union has not included the prohibited Kurdish Workers Party in its second list of terrorists.

hl.seg: 27/ Chinese Foreign Minister holds telephone conversations with his Pakistani and Indian counterparts

p.seg: / First and last addition /

During discussions held with Singh, Tang confirmed the Chinese stand towards fighting any form of terrorism, and repeated condemnations of terrorist attacks against the Indian parliamentary building on 13 December.

Tang affirmed that Indian-Pakistani relations had a direct bearing on the peace and stability of the entire South Asian region, expressing hope that China would help ease tensions in these relations soon.

Tang pointed out that preserving peace and stability in South Asia is of vital importance in achieving smooth progress towards a political resolution of the Afghan issue, and that India, as a major state in South Asia, could play a more positive role in this respect.
Singh clarified the Indian perspective to Tang concerning the present status quo, and reiterated the initial Indian position of fighting any form of terrorism.
He also said that peace and quiet were essential to all the countries of South Asia, including India and Pakistan, and that war should not be resorted to as a means of solving problems.
Singh stated that he expected all parties to curb animosity, bolster dialogue, and coexist in peace.

Tang stated that the meeting of the heads of the states or governments of the South Asia League for Regional Cooperation, to be held in Nepal, is of immense importance, and that China expected this summit to be a success.

hl.seg: 19/ European complaint of influx of Syrian yarn

p.seg: Damascus 31 December/ Xinhua / Syrian newspaper, Al-Baath, published today, stated that the European Union complained of the influx of Syrian yarn, describing it as flooding the market.

The newspaper indicated that the Committee for Economizing Imports, Exports and Consumption met yesterday and discussed the European Union claim that Syrian Yarn companies exported quantities of cotton yarn to the countries of the European Union at lower than global prices.

The paper pointed out that the director of the General Trade Department of the European Union in Damascus had earlier visited the head of the Committee for Imports and Exports. Together they reviewed the subject, particularly the difficulties emerging from flooding the European market with Syrian cotton yarn. He also learnt of the current state of the industry, in so far as the new employments in this sector, the export policies, and the support provided for yarn exported to the European Union are concerned. It was made clear to him that Syria provided no subsidies for either exporters or producers, and that the export price is similar to that of the local market.

The newspaper stated that the Syrian Prime Minister, Mostafa Miro, examined the subject together with the Syrian Assistant Minister for Economy, Dr. Shibli Abu Fakhr, and Syrian Finance Minister, Dr. Mohamed Al-Atrash, and Head of the State Planning Agency, Tawfik Ismail. They all concluded that there should be a study of the reduction of yarn and cotton exports and an attempt at exporting products in a manufactured form, expecting that the quantity exported to the European Union, estimated at about 35000 tons, would fall due to the shrinking of agricultural plans, and the expansion of the manufacturing basis in Syrian.

hl.seg: 52/ Gulf summit reiterates the necessity of promoting security, peace and stability in the Gulf

p.seg: Masqat, 31 December/ Xinhua / Leaders of the Gulf Cooperation Council re-affirmed here today the importance of promoting security, peace and stability in the Gulf region.
This was part of the closing statement issued by the summit of the 22 leaders of the Gulf Cooperation Council states, which was concluded here this afternoon.

The statement renewed its invitation to Iraq to work towards completing the implementation of all obligations mentioned in the Security Council Resolution relating to the state of affairs between Kuwait and Iraq.

The statement also requested Iraq to take the steps necessary for showing its peace-oriented intentions, and refraining from undertaking any provocative or aggressive action against the State of Kuwait, in implementation of the Security Council Resolution 949 and in a manner that would lead to the establishment of security and stability in the region.

The statement called upon both Iraq and the Secretary General of the United Nations to re-establish dialogue between the two parties, in order to resume cooperation between them according to principles that would enable the Security Council to lift the economic sanctions imposed on Iraq, and terminate the suffering of the Iraqi people.

The statement reiterated the firm attitudes of the Council states concerning the necessity of respecting the independence of Iraq, the integrity of its territories, its regional safety and non-interference in its internal affairs.
The Masqat Gulf summit had started its sessions yesterday evening, and lasted for two days.

hl.seg: Blair extends his condolences to the Peruvian President

p.seg: London, 31 December / Xinhua / British Prime Minister, Tony Blair, expressed Sunday his condolences to Peruvian President, Alejandro Tolido, in the wake of the blaze that broke out in the Peruvian capital, Lima, the night before yesterday, leaving more than 200 people dead.
In the condolence telegram Blair sent to Tolido, he said, "I feel deeply sorry at hearing the news of the fire breaking out in the heart of Lima last night".
Blair sent his telegram from Egypt where he is spending his vacation.
Blair added, "It is a terrible tragedy, and my heart goes out to the families and friends of the victims and the wounded. My prayers go to them".
The blaze, which broke out Saturday night in the Peruvian capital, Lima, destroyed four quarters crowded with shops, causing grave losses in lives and property.

Until Sunday morning, firefighters had recovered 205 bodies. Officials said that the hope of finding more survivors under the rubble has vanished, for the temperature during the blaze had exceeded 600 degrees Celsius.
Due to the enormity of the catastrophe, the Peruvian President, Alejandro Tolido, declared a state of official mourning for two days in the country.

hl.seg: European citizens welcome new stamps dedicated to the Euro

p.seg: /First and final addition /

Other stamps have been issued in Austria, Finland, and Ireland, bearing the national features of these countries, such as their national flags, or a renowned symbol such as historical or cultural monuments, or animal images such as the Finnish Lion.
In Belgium, stamp-collectors are expected to queue up for the first Euro stamps to be issued in Brussels tomorrow, Tuesday, 1 January of the New Year.

As for the citizens of the Euro region, the full change over to the Euro heralds a new phase of the shared use of a unified currency in the most unified of European Union phases. Yet, according to the convictions of analysts, the citizens of these countries will retain all that glorifies their national characteristics and cultural heritage in a unified Europe.

hl.seg: A great increase in foreign investments in Vietnam in 2001

p.seg: / First and final addition /

The industrial and construction sectors in Vietnam include the largest number of new projects, which total 373 projects with an estimated capital of around 2.07 billion American dollars, i.e. with an increase of 30 percent compared to last year's figures.

At the same time, 20 projects are being carried out, with a capital of 25.3 million American dollars or just 1 percent of the total value of direct foreign investments in the sectors of agriculture, forestry and fishing, in the same year.
The services sector in the country has attracted 37 projects, with a capital estimated at 345 million American dollars or 14 percent of the total value.
Among the largest investing countries in Vietnam are South Korea, China, Japan, the United States and Singapore.

hl.seg: Considerable growth in the foreign trade of a Chinese province

p.seg: Xining January 1st / Xinhua / The Qinghai inner Province in North West China registered an accelerating growth in its foreign trade during the first eleven months of the year 2001.

Customs figures indicate that the volume of foreign trade in the Province of Qinghai has exceeded 184 million American dollars, with an increase of 3.22 percent on an annual basis, and a rise of 25 percent over the national rate during the same period.
During the period of eleven months, the Province registered an increase of 39.4 percent in exports and 14.08 percent in imports, both of which were the highest in the country.
The volume of foreign trade is expected to rise to 200 million American dollars for the whole year, with an increase of 25.2 percent on an annual basis.
So far, Qinghai has established relations with 57 countries and regions in the world.
